Lead.text: 2016-07-07 00:50fileIn the east, Daenerys Targaryen, the last scion of House Targaryen, rules with her three dragons as queen of a city built on dust and death.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut Daenerys has thousands of enemies, and many have set out to find her.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Fleeing from Westeros with a price on his head, Tyrion Lannister, too, is making his way to Daenerys.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere, Jon Snow, 998th Lord Commander of the Nights Watch, will face his greatest challenge.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > for Lodey, Trebla, Stego, Pod, < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bronn Stone, Coyotes Daughter, < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Whereas < emphasis > Feast < / emphasis > focused on events in and around Kings Landing, on the Iron Islands, and down in Dorne, < emphasis > Dance < / emphasis > takes us north to Castle Black and the Wall (and beyond), and across the narrow sea to Pentos and Slavers Bay, to pick up the tales of Tyrion Lannister, Jon Snow, Daenerys Targaryen, and all the other characters you did
2016-07-07 00:50fileOthers were slain by those who had been their brothers-in-arms when they marched south with Mance Rayder, the King-Beyond-the-Wall.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Mance is fallen, < / emphasis > the survivors told each other in despairing voices, < emphasis > Mance is taken, Mance is dead.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Harmas dead and Mance is captured, the rest run off and left us, Thistle had claimed, as she was sewing up his wound. Tormund, the Weeper, Sixskins, all them brave raiders.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I was Varamyr Six-skins, who broke bread with Mance Rayder.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHis sleeping pelts and woolen smallclothes, his sheepskin boots and fur-lined gloves, his store of mead and hoarded food, the hanks of hair he took from the women he bedded, even the golden arm rings Mance had given him, all lost and left behind.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIf Mance is dead, the free folk are doomed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe rode to battle on the back of a snow bear thirteen feet tall, kept three wolves and a shadowcat in thrall, and sat at the right hand of Mance Rayder.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > It was Mance who brought me to this place.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Before Mance, Varamyr Sixskins had been a lord of sorts.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMance would have cursed him as well, but Mance was slain or captured.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > It would be good to feel warm again, though it made him sad to think that he would never see the green lands, the warm lands beyond the Wall that Mance used to sing about. The world beyond the Wall is not for our kind, Haggon used to say. The free folk fear skinchangers, but they honor us as well.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOrell had been slain by the turncloak crow Jon Snow, and his hate for his killer had been so strong that Varamyr found himself hating the beastling boy as well.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe had known what Snow was the moment he saw that great white direwolf stalking silent at his side.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Mance should have let me take the direwolf.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe gift was strong in Snow, but the youth was untaught, still fighting his nature when he should have gloried in it.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > TYRION < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion marked time by the comings and goings of the cabin boy who brought the meals he did not eat.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe boy always brought a brush and bucket too, to clean up. Is this Dornish wine? Tyrion asked him once, as he pulled a stopper from a skin. It reminds me of a certain snake I knew.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe was an ugly boy, though admittedly more comely than a certain dwarf with half a nose and a scar from eye to chin. Have I offended you? Tyrion asked, as the boy was scrubbing. Were you commanded not to talk to me?
2016-07-07 00:50fileTell me that. Jaime had made mention of the Free Cities, but had never said which one. Is it Braavos?
2016-07-07 00:50fileMyr? Tyrion would sooner have gone to Dorne.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Myrcella is older than Tommen, by Dornish law the Iron Throne is hers.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI will help her claim her rights, as Prince Oberyn suggested.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Oberyn was dead, though, his head smashed to bloody ruin by the armored fist of Ser Gregor Clegane.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd without the Red Viper to urge him on, would Doran Martell even consider such a chancy scheme?
2016-07-07 00:50fileOld Bear Mormont said the Nights Watch had need of men like Tyrion.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJanos Slynt would see to that.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The cabin boy wet his brush and scrubbed on manfully. Have you ever visited the pleasure houses of Lys? the dwarf inquired. Might that be where whores go? Tyrion could not seem to recall the Valyrian word for whore, and in any case it was too late.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion had some Braavosi and a smattering of Myrish.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Sleep had never come easily to Tyrion Lannister.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > It was all beyond his reach, Tyrion knew now.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The crossbow < emphasis > thrumm < / emphasis > ed, Lord Tywin sat back down, and Tyrion Lannister found himself waddling through the darkness with Varys at his side.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Varys had escorted him through the tunnels, but they never spoke until they emerged beside the Blackwater, where Tyrion had won a famous victory and lost a nose.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Wherever whores go. Tyrion had warned his father not to say that word.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I killed Shae too, he confessed to Varys.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Varys tittered. And now you do. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileVarys had saved him from a headsmans sword, but only because Jaime had compelled him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Jaime no, better not to think of Jaime.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion told him to be quiet and kicked feebly as a huge bald sailor tucked him under one arm and carried him squirming to the hold, where an empty wine cask awaited him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion pissed himself in his struggles, for all the good it did.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnother cask slammed into his, and Tyrion bit his tongue.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion gasped greedily and tried to stand, but only managed to knock the cask over sideways and spill himself out onto a hard-packed earthen floor.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe reminded Tyrion of a dead sea cow that had once washed up in the caverns under Casterly Rock.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI like that in a dwarf. When the fat man laughed, his flesh bounced so vigorously that Tyrion was afraid he might fall and crush him. Are you hungry, my little friend?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Thirsty. Tyrion struggled to his knees. And filthy. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileAny friend of my friend across the water is a friend to Illyrio Mopatis, yes. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > And any friend of Varys the Spider is someone I will trust just as far as I can throw him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileNo sooner did Tyrion lower himself into the hot water and close his eyes than he was fast asleep.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion shook the last drops off and waddled over patterned Myrish carpets as soft as new spring grass.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAwkwardly he climbed the window seat and flung the shutters open to see where Varys and the gods had sent him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When he heard the door opening behind him, Tyrion turned to confront his fat host. This is Pentos, yes? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The fat man stroked one of the prongs of his oiled yellow beard, a gesture Tyrion found remarkably obscene. Slavery is forbidden in Pentos, by the terms of the treaty the Braavosi imposed on us a hundred years ago.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStill, they will not refuse you. Illyrio gave a ponderous half bow. But now my little friend must excuse me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Yes, my fat friend, Tyrion replied.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShould a day ever dawn when Illyrio Mopatis saw more profit in a dead dwarf than a live one, Tyrion would find himself packed into another wine cask by dusk.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > That it would arrive he did not doubt; Cersei was not like to forget him, and even Jaime might be vexed to find a quarrel in Fathers belly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Wherever whores go, he heard Lord Tywin say once more, and once more the bowstring < emphasis > thrum < / emphasis > med.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion began his explorations with the kitchen, where two fat women and a potboy watched him warily as he helped himself to cheese, bread, and figs. Good morrow to you, fair ladies, he said with a bow. Do you know where whores go? When they did not respond, he repeated the question in High Valyrian, though he had to say < emphasis > courtesan < / emphasis > in place of < emphasis
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > None will dare refuse you, < / emphasis > Illyrio claimed, but somehow Tyrion did not think he meant these two.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBoth were near as fat as Illyrio, with teats that were larger than his head.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Lord Tywin might have been niggardly with his approval and affection, but he had always been open-handed when it came to coin.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion left the fat women to their loaves and kettles and went in search of the cellar where Illyrio had decanted him the night before.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIn the end, Tyrion chose a cask of strongwine marked as the private stock of Lord Runceford Redwyne, the grandfather of the present Lord of the Arbor.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion filled a cup, and a flagon for good measure, and carried them up to the gardens to drink beneath those cherry trees hed seen.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion pictured how his sisters head might look up there, with tar in her golden hair and flies buzzing in and out of her mouth.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Yes, and Jaime must have the spike beside her, < / emphasis > he decided.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion knew eunuchs when he saw them.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion settled on a stone bench with his flagon. Tell me, how far should I trust Magister Illyrio? The name made her look up. That far? Chuckling, he crossed his stunted legs and took a drink. I am loath to play whatever part the cheesemonger has in mind for me, yet how can I refuse him?
2016-07-07 00:50fileI could make rather a lot of mischief in Dorne with Myrcella.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I cannot seem to hold a wife for very long, < / emphasis > Tyrion reflected.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Or better yet, he should have asked his father. Wherever whores go, Lord Tywin said.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion pushed himself off the bench and went to fetch it.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMagister Illyrio expects you at table within the hour. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion propped himself against the pillows, his head in his hands. Do I dream, or do you speak the Common Tongue? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She poured for him. Magister Illyrio said that I am to scrub your back and warm your bed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > That he had fucked many a woman who loathed the very sight of him, Tyrion Lannister had no doubt, but the others had at least the grace to feign affection.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Even Lord Tywin had not been afraid, though Tyrion had held a crossbow in his hands. Do you moan when you are being fucked? he asked the bedwarmer.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Illyrio was reclining on a padded couch, gobbling hot peppers and pearl onions from a wooden bowl.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I could live for years on his rings, < / emphasis > Tyrion mused, < emphasis > though Id need a cleaver to claim them.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Come sit, my little friend. Illyrio waved him closer.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion Lannister had lived all his life in a world that was too big for him, but in the manse of Illyrio Mopatis the sense of disproportion assumed grotesque dimensions.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Did you enjoy the girl I sent you? Illyrio asked. If I had wanted a girl I would have asked for one. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I kill kings, hadnt you heard? Tyrion smiled evilly over his wine cup. I want no royal leavings. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileLet us eat. Illyrio clapped his hands together, and serving men came running.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe sight of it all made Tyrion feel queasy, but he forced himself to try a spoon of soup for the sake of politeness, and once he had tasted it he was lost.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As he was sucking the meat off the bones of his quail, he asked Illyrio about the mornings summons.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIllyrio reached for a piece of the crackling, dipped it in a plum sauce, and ate it with his fingers.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Slavers Bay is a long way from Pentos. Tyrion speared a goose liver on the point of his knife.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > This is so, Illyrio agreed, but the world is one great web, and a man dare not touch a single strand lest all the others tremble.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMore wine? Illyrio popped a pepper into his mouth. No, something better. He clapped his hands together.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe placed it in front of Tyrion, and Illyrio leaned across the table to remove the lid. Mushrooms, the magister announced, as the smell wafted up. Kissed with garlic and bathed in butter.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion had a fat black mushroom halfway to his mouth, but something in Illyrios voice made him stop abruptly. After you, my lord. He pushed the dish toward his host.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No, no. Magister Illyrio pushed the mushrooms back.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Did she indeed? He remembered the cook, the flour on her hands, heavy breasts shot through with dark blue veins. That was kind of her, but no. Tyrion eased the mushroom back into the lake of butter from which it had emerged.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You are too suspicious. Illyrio smiled through his forked yellow beard.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOiled every morning to make it gleam like gold, Tyrion suspected. Are you craven?

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Here as well. Illyrio Mopatis reached for his wine cup. Yet when a guest plainly wishes to end his own life, why, his host must oblige him, no? He took a gulp. Magister Ordello was poisoned by a mushroom not half a year ago.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You mistake me, Tyrion said again, more loudly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You have nothing, finished Magister Illyrio, but we can change that. He plucked a mushroom from the butter, and chewed it lustily. Delicious. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The mushrooms are not poisoned. Tyrion was irritated.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhy should I wish you ill? Magister Illyrio ate another. We must show a little trust, you and I. Come, eat. He clapped his hands again. We have work to do.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion refused the swan, which reminded him of a supper with his sister.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The lords of the Seven Kingdoms did make rather much of their sigils, Tyrion had to admit. Very well, he conceded. A Lannister is not a lion.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYet I am still my fathers son, and Jaime and Cersei are mine to kill. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > How odd that you should mention your fair sister, said Illyrio, between snails. The queen has offered a lordship to the man who brings her your head, no matter how humble his birth. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > It was no more than Tyrion had expected. If you mean to take her up on it, make her spread her legs for you as well.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I would sooner have mine own weight in gold. The cheesemonger laughed so hard that Tyrion feared he was about to rupture. All the gold in Casterly Rock, why not? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Just so. The magister covered his mouth and belched a mighty belch. Do you think King Stannis will give it to you?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis might well grant me Casterly Rock, said Tyrion, but for the small matter of regicide and kinslaying.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut why would you think I mean to join Lord Stannis? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis is at the Wall? Tyrion rubbed at his nose. What in seven bloody hells is Stannis doing at the Wall? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion was beginning to suspect that a certain freckled washerwoman knew more of the Common Speech than she pretended. My niece Myrcella is in Dorne, as it happens.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Illyrio smiled as his serving men spooned out bowls of black cherries in sweet cream for them both. What has this poor child done to you that you would wish her dead? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even a kinslayer is not required to slay < emphasis > all < / emphasis > his kin, said Tyrion, wounded. Queen her, I said.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDorne might rise for Myrcella, but Dorne alone is not enough.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion looked at the fat man with new interest.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Magister Illyrio wiped sweet cream from his mouth with the back of a fat hand. The road to Casterly Rock does not go through Dorne, my little friend.

2016-07-07 00:50fileOn the first day of each new year he must deflower the maid of the fields and the maid of the seas. Illyrio leaned forward, elbows on the table. Yet should a crop fail or a war be lost, we cut his throat to appease the gods and choose a new prince from amongst the forty families. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Not Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Stronger than Tommen, gentler than Stannis, with a better claim than the girl Myrcella.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Fine words. Tyrion was unimpressed. Words are wind.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > DAENERYS < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileDaenerys Targaryen awaited him upon the ebon bench that she had made her throne.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace, said Ser Barristan Selmy, the lord commander of her Queensguard, there is no need for you to see this. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He died for me. Dany clutched her lion pelt to her chest.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe had been dreaming of a house with a red door when Missandei woke her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey had been given to her when she wed Khal Drogo.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt was Drogo who had given her the pelt she wore, the head and hide of a < emphasis > hrakkar, < / emphasis > the white lion of the Dothraki sea.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Grey Worm appeared atop the steps first, a torch in hand.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Barristan pulled back the bloodstained shroud.
2016-07-07 00:50fileGrey Worm lowered the torch, so she might see.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace, Ser Barristan said, there was a harpy drawn on the bricks in the alley where he was found < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > drawn in blood. Daenerys knew the way of it by now.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even those who lack a mans parts may still have a mans heart, Your Grace, said Grey Worm. This one has been told that your servant Stalwart Shield sometimes gave coin to the women of the brothels to lie with him and hold him. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Six or more, said Ser Barristan. From the look of his wounds, they swarmed him from all sides.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany said a silent prayer that somewhere one of the Harpys Sons was dying even now, clutching at his belly and writhing in pain. Why did they cut open his cheeks like that? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Gracious queen, said Grey Worm, his killers had forced the genitals of a goat down the throat of your servant Stalwart Shield.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The Sons grow bolder, Dany observed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The first, Ser Barristan warned, but not the last. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > I am still at war, < / emphasis > Dany realized, < emphasis > only now I am fighting shadows.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > It shall be as Your Grace commands, said Grey Worm.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Daenerys pushed her hair back. Find these cowards for me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Grey Worm saluted her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Barristan Selmy remained behind.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany settled on her bench and wrapped her pelt about her shoulders once again. The Unsullied are my finest warriors. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileSo Dany had dispatched her tiny < emphasis > khalasar < / emphasis > to subdue the hinterlands, under the command of her three bloodriders, whilst Brown Ben Plumm took his Second Sons south to guard against Yunkish incursions.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The most crucial task of all she had entrusted to Daario Naharis, glib-tongued Daario with his gold tooth and trident beard, smiling his wicked smile through purple whiskers.

2016-07-07 00:50fileIf Daario could convince the Lhazarene to reopen the overland trade routes, grains could be brought down the river or over the hills at need but the Lamb Men had no reason to love Meereen. When the Stormcrows return from Lhazar, perhaps I can use them in the streets, she told Ser Barristan, but until then I have only the Unsullied. Dany rose. You must excuse me, ser.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAs a cool blue dawn broke over the city, Dany walked out onto the terrace.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen Dany passed his eyes came open, two pools of molten gold.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > She had read that in one of the books Ser Jorah had given her as a wedding gift. You should be hunting with your brothers.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Then she would fly as Aegon the Conqueror had flown, up and up, until Meereen was so small that she could blot it out with her thumb.

2016-07-07 00:50fileOnly then did Dany go back inside the pyramid, where Irri and Jhiqui were waiting to brush the tangles from her hair and garb her as befit the Queen of Meereen, in a Ghiscari < emphasis > tokar.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany had wanted to ban the < emphasis > tokar < / emphasis > when she took Meereen, but her advisors had convinced her otherwise. The Mother of Dragons must don the < emphasis > tokar < / emphasis > or be forever hated, warned the Green Grace, Galazza Galare. In the wools of Westeros or a gown of Myrish lace, Your Radiance shall forever remain a stranger amongst us, a grotesque outlander

2016-07-07 00:50fileMeereens queen must be a lady of Old Ghis. Brown Ben Plumm, the captain of the Second Sons, had put it more succinctly. Man wants to be the king o the rabbits, he best wear a pair o floppy ears. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Some Aegon, but which one?
2016-07-07 00:50fileAegon would have been closer to my age than Viserys.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany had only been conceived when Aegon and his sister were murdered.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTheir father, her brother Rhaegar, perished even earlier, slain by the Usurper on the Trident.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHer brother Viserys had died screaming in Vaes Dothrak with a crown of molten gold upon his head.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAfter Meereen had fallen, Dany had nailed up a like number of Great Masters.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You are kind to say so, Dany answered, in the same tongue.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOthers followed, though whether from fear, fashion, or ambition, Dany could not say; shavepates, they were called.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > How can I punish them when I do not know who they are? Dany demanded of him. Tell me that, bold Skahaz. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > No, < / emphasis > Dany thought, < emphasis > and the Usurpers dogs will learn that, when I return to Westeros.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThree uncles had been among the hundred sixty-three on the plaza. How much gold have we offered for information concerning the Sons of the Harpy? Dany asked.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere were times when Dany wondered if that razor might not be better saved for Reznaks throat.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMirri Maz Duur had been the first, Ser Jorah the second.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Or will it be someone I would never suspect, Ser Barristan or Grey Worm or Missandei?
2016-07-07 00:50fileReznak, see what one thousand honors may accomplish. Clutching her < emphasis > tokar, < / emphasis > Daenerys swept past them down the broad marble stair.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Missandei announced her.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe little scribe had a sweet, strong voice. <emphasis > All kneel for Daenerys Stormborn, the Unburnt, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men, < / emphasis > Khaleesi < emphasis > of Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Shackles, and Mother of Dragons.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Arise. Dany settled onto her bench.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe also had a gift. Cleon the Great sends these slippers as a token of his love for Daenerys Stormborn, the Mother of Dragons. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany had small feet, yet the pointed slippers mashed her toes together.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Great Cleon will be pleased to know they pleased you, said Lord Ghael. His Magnificence bids me say that he stands ready to defend the Mother of Dragons from all her foes. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > If he proposes again that I wed King Cleon, Ill throw a slipper at his head, < / emphasis > Dany thought, but for once the Astapori envoy made no mention of a royal marriage.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > King Cleon would be wise to tend his own gardens and let the Yunkaii tend theirs. It was not that Dany harbored any love for Yunkai.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Magnificence, prompted Reznak mo Reznak, will you hear the noble Hizdahr zo Loraq? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany nodded, and Hizdahr strode forth; a tall man, very slender, with flawless amber skin.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I need this man, < / emphasis > Dany reminded herself.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe had visited Volantis, Lys, and Qarth, had kin in Tolos and Elyria, and was even said to wield some influence in New Ghis, where the Yunkaii were trying to stir up enmity against Dany and her rule.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > When Dany had closed the citys fighting pits, the value of pit shares had plummeted.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHizdahr zo Loraq had grabbed them up with both hands, and now owned most of the fighting pits in Meereen.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShall I? Dany leaned forward. The fighting pits have been a part of Meereen since the city was founded.
2016-07-07 00:50fileA very limber man was Hizdahr zo Loraq.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Reznak and the Green Grace had been urging Dany to take a Meereenese noble for her husband, to reconcile the city to her rule.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHizdahr zo Loraq might be worth a careful look.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > It would be my pleasure, said Dany, admiring the glimmer of the gold and the sheen of the green pearls on Cleons slippers while doing her best to ignore the pinching in her toes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany had refused to compensate any of the Great Masters for the value of their slaves, but the Meereenese kept devising other ways to squeeze coin from her.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany listened quietly, her face still.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Reznak would have summoned another < emphasis > tokar < / emphasis > next, but Dany insisted that he call upon a freedman.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany granted her the jewels but ruled the house was lost when she abandoned it.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany granted him the gold, but not the gelding. When he lay with her, your wife was his property, to do with as he would.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A boy came, younger than Dany, slight and scarred, dressed up in a frayed grey < emphasis > tokar < / emphasis > trailing silver fringe.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany had no choice but to deny him.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe huge brown eunuch yanked him up one-handed and shook him like a mastiff with a rat. Enough, Belwas, Dany called. Release him. To the boy she said, Treasure that < emphasis > tokar, < / emphasis > for it saved your life.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou should do the same. But as he left the boy looked back over his shoulder, and when she saw his eyes Dany thought, < emphasis > The Harpy has another Son.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > By midday Daenerys was feeling the weight of the crown upon her head, and the hardness of the bench beneath her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany kicked them off and sat with one foot tucked beneath her and the other swinging back and forth.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe crown had given her a headache, and her buttocks had gone to sleep. Ser Barristan, she called, I know what quality a king needs most. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I have too many councillors and too few cushions. Dany turned to Reznak. How many more? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Three-and-twenty. Dany sighed. My dragons have developed a prodigious taste for mutton since we began to pay the shepherds for their kills.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBrown Ben says there are red wolves in the hills outside the city, and jack-als and wild dogs.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Daenerys shifted on the bench. No man should ever fear to come to me. Some claims were false, she did not doubt, but more were genuine.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > The more they eat, the larger they will grow, < / emphasis > Ser Barristan had warned her, < emphasis > and the larger they grow, the more theyll eat.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > You would think they might be happier, < / emphasis > Dany thought.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany wondered.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > All kneel for Daenerys Stormborn, the Unburnt, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men, < / emphasis > Khaleesi < emphasis > of Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Shackles, and Mother of Dragons, < / emphasis > cried Missandei in her high, sweet voice.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As Dany stood, her < emphasis > tokar < / emphasis > began to slip.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany glimpsed Ser Barristan sliding closer, a white shadow at her side.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > What is it? Dany asked. Do you have some grievance to lay before us, some petition?
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany shivered.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Reznak, Ser Barristan said quietly, hold your tongue and open your eyes.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > No, < / emphasis > Dany thought, < emphasis > those are the bones of a child.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSnow crunched beneath his paws.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe white wolf turned and bared his teeth. <emphasis > Snow!
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > His fur rose bristling, as the woods dissolved around him. <emphasis > Snow, snow, snow!
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > It landed on Jon Snows chest with a < emphasis > thump < / emphasis > and a scrabbling of claws. <emphasis > SNOW!
2016-07-07 00:50fileGet your feathers out of my face. Jon wriggled an arm out from under his blankets to shoo the raven off.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt was a big bird, old and bold and scruffy, utterly without fear. <emphasis > Snow, < / emphasis > it cried, flapping to his bedpost. <emphasis > Snow, snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon filled his fist with a pillow and let fly, but the bird took to the air.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe pillow struck the wall and burst, scattering stuffing everywhere just as Dolorous Edd Tollett poked his head through the door. Beg pardon, he said, ignoring the flurry of feathers, shall I fetch mlord some breakfast? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Roast raven, Jon suggested. And half a pint of ale. Having a steward fetch and serve for him still felt strange; not long ago, it would have been him fetching breakfast for Lord Commander Mormont.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Three corns and one roast raven, said Dolorous Edd. Very good, mlord, only Hobbs made boiled eggs, black sausage, and apples stewed with prunes.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Later. Breakfast could wait; Stannis could not. Any trouble from the stockades last night? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Good. A thousand wildlings had been penned up beyond the Wall, the captives Stannis Baratheon had taken when his knights had smashed Mance Rayders patchwork host.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > They had free folk drifting in most every night, starved half-frozen creatures who had run from the battle beneath the Wall only to crawl back when they realized there was no safe place to run to. Was the mother questioned? Jon asked.

2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis Baratheon had smashed Mance Rayders host and made the King-Beyond-the-Wall his captive but the wildlings were still out there, the Weeper and Tormund Giantsbane and thousands more.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Burning dead children had ceased to trouble Jon Snow; live ones were another matter.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The words had been murmured by one of the queens men as Maester Aemon had cleaned his wounds.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon had tried to dismiss them as his fever talking.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAemon had demurred. There is power in a kings blood, the old maester had warned, and better men than Stannis have done worse things than this. < emphasis > The king can be harsh and unforgiving, aye, but a babe still on the breast?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon pissed in darkness, filling his chamber pot as the Old Bears raven muttered complaints.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Robb had died at the Twins, betrayed by men hed believed his friends, and his wolf had perished with him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran and Rickon had been murdered too, beheaded at the behest of Theon Greyjoy, who had once been their lord fathers ward but if dreams did not lie, their direwolves had escaped.

2016-07-07 00:50fileMormonts raven watched with shrewd black eyes, then fluttered to the window. Do you take me for your thrall? When Jon folded back the window with its thick diamond-shaped panes of yellow glass, the chill of the morning hit him in the face.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWith Stannis in the Kings Tower and the Lord Commanders Tower burned to a shell, Jon had established himself in Donal Noyes modest rooms behind the armory.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon moved the cup aside and read the parchment once again.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis Baratheon was proving to be a prickly guest, and a restless one.
2016-07-07 00:50fileEach night he walked atop the Wall with Lady Melisandre, and during the days he visited the stockades, picking captives out for the red woman to question.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > This would not be a pleasant morning, Jon feared.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I think I can find the Kings Tower by myself. Jon hated having guards trailing after him everywhere he went.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon stopped to watch a moment as Horse pressed Hop-Robin back toward the well.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Well fought, Jon said to Horse, but you drop your shield too low when pressing an attack.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Kings men in one corner and queens men in another, < / emphasis > Jon did not fail to note, < emphasis > but only a few.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Boy < / emphasis > was not the worst of the things that Jon Snow had been called since being chosen lord commander.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Snow, < / emphasis > the voice insisted, <emphasis > Lord Commander.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon had seen this one about the castle" a knight of great renown, to hear him tell it.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon remembered Ygritte, crying.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You will excuse me. Jon showed them his back.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > My command, < / emphasis > Jon Snow reflected ruefully, < emphasis > as much a ruin as it is a strong-hold.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Above the Kings Tower the great golden battle standard of House Baratheon cracked like a whip from the roof where Jon Snow had prowled with bow in hand not long ago, slaying Thenns and free folk beside Satin and Deaf Dick Follard.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTwo queens men stood shivering on the steps, their hands tucked up into their armpits and their spears leaning against the door. Those cloth gloves will never serve, Jon told them. See Bowen Marsh on the morrow, and hell give you each a pair of leather gloves lined with fur. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Nothing, < / emphasis > thought Jon Snow, < emphasis > the same as me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Halfway up the winding steps, he came upon Samwell Tarly, headed down. Are you coming from the king? Jon asked him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Maester Aemon sent me with a letter. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I see. Some lords trusted their maesters to read their letters and convey the contents, but Stannis insisted on breaking the seals himself. How did Stannis take it? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Not happily, by his face. Sam dropped his voice to a whisper. I am not supposed to speak of it. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Then dont. Jon wondered which of his fathers bannermen had refused King Stannis homage this time.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I found a good book about archery. Sam frowned. Doing it is harder than reading about it, though.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYour knives as well. It would do no good to protest, Jon knew.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLady Melisandre was seated near the fire, her ruby glimmering against the pale skin of her throat.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYgritte had been kissed by fire; the red priestess < emphasis > was < / emphasis > fire, and her hair was blood and flame.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis stood behind the rough-hewn table where the Old Bear had once been wont to sit and take his meals.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon took a knee.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTell me, who is < emphasis > Lyanna Mormont < / emphasis >? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon had to think a moment. Ten.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis read from the letter. <emphasis > Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North, whose name is STARK.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > A girl of ten, you say, and she presumes to scold her lawful king. His close-cropped beard lay like a shadow over his hollow cheeks. See that you keep these tidings to yourself, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As you command, Sire. Maege Mormont had ridden south with Robb, Jon knew.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHad they gone with Robb as well?

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe did not understand why Lyanna should be writing Stannis, and could not help but wonder if the girls answer might have been different if the letter had been sealed with a direwolf instead of a crowned stag, and signed by Jon Stark, Lord of Winterfell.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe had been made the castellan of Karhold when his nephew and his sons went south with Robb, and he had been the first to respond to King Stanniss call for homage, with a raven declaring his allegiance.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > The Karstarks have no other choice, < / emphasis > Jon might have said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lady Melisandre stirred. Tell me, Lord Snow where were these other kings when the wild people stormed your Wall? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A thousand leagues away and deaf to our need, Jon replied. I have not forgotten that, my lady.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Answers such as this? Stannis crushed Lyannas letter in his fist.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even in the north men fear the wroth of Tywin Lannister.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey north rode with Robb, bled with him, died for him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If His Grace is doomed, your realm is doomed as well, said Lady Melisandre. Remember that, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon kept his face a mask. As you say, my lady. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis snorted. You spend your words as if every one were a golden dragon.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis had commanded Jon not to speak of that one either.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Perhaps his lordship would fancy a wildling wife, said Lady Melisandre. Is this fat man married, Lord Snow? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileVal would never have him. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Just once you might try to give me an answer that would please me, Lord Snow, the king grumbled.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYour men call Val a princess, but to the free folk she is only the sister of their kings dead wife.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe only man who can bind them to your cause is Mance Rayder. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I know that, Stannis said, unhappily. I have spent hours speaking with the man.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMance Rayders life is forfeit by every law of the Seven Kingdoms. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace is mistaken. < emphasis > You know nothing, Jon Snow, < / emphasis > Ygritte used to say, but he had learned. The babe is no more a prince than Val is a princess.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Good, said Stannis, for I will suffer no other kings in Westeros.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon closed his burned fingers and opened them again. You ask too much. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileDid Lord Eddard teach his bastard nothing?
2016-07-07 00:50fileA son of Eddard Stark.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe threw my offer in my face. Stannis Baratheon with a grievance was like a mastiff with a bone; he gnawed it down to splinters.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon knew better than to press the point. Sire, some claim that you mean to grant lands and castles to Rattleshirt and the Magnar of Thenn. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Who is < emphasis > Gilly < / emphasis >? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The wet nurse, said Lady Melisandre. Your Grace gave her freedom of the castle. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Castle Black needs no useless mouths, Jon agreed. I am sending Gilly south on the next ship out of Eastwatch. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Melisandre touched the ruby at her neck. Gilly is giving suck to Dallas son as well as her own.
2016-07-07 00:50fileCraster was his father, a cruel man and greedy, and blood tells. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileCraster married all his daughters.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Her own < emphasis > father < / emphasis > got this child on her? Stannis sounded shocked. We are well rid of her, then.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Poor fare for a prince but better than whores milk, aye. Stannis drummed his fingers on the map. If we may return to the matter of these forts < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace, said Jon, with chilly courtesy, I have housed your men and fed them, at dire cost to our winter stores.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis was not appeased. Aye, youve shared your salt pork and porridge, and youve thrown us some black rags to keep us warm.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon ignored that. I have given you fodder for your horses, and once the stair is done I will lend you builders to restore the Nightfort.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > to defend the Wall, Jon finished stubbornly, not as seats for southron lords.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWas ever a name more ill-omened? Stannis touched his sword hilt. Just who do you imagine that you are? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dont prate your words at me. Stannis drew the blade he called Lightbringer. <emphasis > Here < / emphasis > is your sword in the darkness. Light rippled up and down the blade, now red, now yellow, now orange, painting the kings face in harsh, bright hues. Even a green boy should be able to see that.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis stared at him incredulously, then gave a bark of laughter. You are bold enough, Snow, I grant you that, but youre mad if you think my men will take the black. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey tell me that you are the nine-hundred-ninety-eighth man to command the Nights Watch, Lord Snow.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I am lord commander because my brothers chose me. There were mornings when Jon Snow did not quite believe it himself, when he woke up thinking surely this was some mad dream.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Its like putting on new clothes, < / emphasis > Sam had told him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMy father always said you were a just man. < emphasis > Just but harsh < / emphasis > had been Lord Eddards exact words, but Jon did not think it would be wise to share that.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Eddard was no friend to me, but he was not without some sense.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWe will see how well you hold it. Stannis pointed at him. Keep your ruins, as they mean so much to you.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lady Melisandre rose from her place near the hearth. With your leave, Sire, I will show Lord Snow back to his chambers. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe knows the way. Stannis waved them both away. Do what you will.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > After the warmth of the kings solar, the turnpike stair felt bone-chillingly cold. Winds rising, mlady, the serjeant warned Melisandre as he handed Jon back his weapons. You might want a warmer cloak. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I have my faith to warm me. The red woman walked beside Jon down the steps. His Grace is growing fond of you. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Melisandre laughed. It is his silences you should fear, not his words. As they stepped out into the yard, the wind filled Jons cloak and sent it flapping against her.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon could feel her heat, even through his wool and boiled leather.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Rhllor sends us what visions he will, but I shall seek for this man Tormund in the flames. Melisandres red lips curled into a smile. I have seen you in my fires, Jon Snow. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon did not deny it. The Wall is no place for a woman. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileI have dreamed of your Wall, Jon Snow.

2016-07-07 00:50fileWe walk beneath one of the hinges of the world. Melisandre gazed up at it, her breath a warm moist cloud in the air. This is my place as it is yours, and soon enough you may have grave need of me.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDo not refuse my friendship, Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Then you know nothing, Jon Snow, she whispered.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran never said the words aloud, but they were often on his lips as their ragged company trudged through groves of ancient oaks and towering grey-green sentinels, past gloomy soldier pines and bare brown chestnut trees.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > the boy would wonder, as Hodor clambered up a stony slope, or descended into some dark crevice where drifts of dirty snow cracked beneath his feet.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHodor walked with one eye frozen shut, his thick brown beard a tangle of hoarfrost, icicles drooping from the ends of his bushy mustache.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOn their journey from Winterfell to the Wall, Bran and his companions had made the miles shorter by talking and telling tales, but it was different here.
2016-07-07 00:50fileEven Hodor felt it.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere was a stillness to this wood like nothing Bran had ever known before.

2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Coldhands < / emphasis > was the name that the fat boy Sam had given him, for though the rangers face was pale, his hands were black and hard as iron, and cold as iron too.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Behind the ranger, Meera Reed wrapped her arms around her brother, to shelter him from the wind and cold with the warmth of her own body.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > He looks so small, < / emphasis > Bran thought, as he watched him sway.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran felt the pain of the old wound whenever he slipped inside the big wolfs skin.

2016-07-07 00:50fileOf late Bran wore Summers body more often than his own; the wolf felt the bite of the cold, despite the thickness of his fur, but he could see farther and hear better and smell more than the boy in the basket, bundled up like a babe in swaddling clothes.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Other times, when he was tired of being a wolf, Bran slipped into Hodors skin instead.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe big stableboy never understood what was happening, and Bran could taste the fear at the back of his mouth.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Sometimes Bran could sense the direwolf sniffing after the elk, wondering if he could bring the great beast down.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > From a nearby oak a raven < emphasis > quork < / emphasis > ed, and Bran heard the sound of wings as another of the big black birds flapped down to land beside it.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSome would fly to the ranger and mutter at him, and it seemed to Bran that he understood their < emphasis > quork < / emphasis > s and < emphasis > squawk < / emphasis > s.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > What is it? Meera wanted to know.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Wolves? Bran asked.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Often Bran woke shivering hours before the dawn, listening to the sound of them calling to one another in the distance as he waited for the sun to rise.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Meera Reed pushed back her hood.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran thought that Meera meant to argue until her brother said, Do as he says.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe knows this land. Jojens eyes were a dark green, the color of moss, but heavy with a weariness that Bran had never seen in them before.
2016-07-07 00:50fileEven so, Meera always listened to him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMeera watched him go, her cheeks red with cold, breath puffing from her nostrils.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He said hed go and deal with them, said Bran.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Rivers turn and twist, Bran said uncertainly, and where theres lakes and hills, you need to go around. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Theres been too much < emphasis > going around, < / emphasis > Meera insisted, and too many secrets.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Bran had been afraid to speak of it, but he had noticed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhenever they took shelter for the night, while he and Hodor and the Reeds huddled together for warmth, the ranger kept apart.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSometimes Cold-hands closed his eyes, but Bran did not think he slept.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The scarf. Bran glanced about uneasily, but there was not a raven to be seen.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Meera gave him a sharp look. Youre right.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen Jojen or his sister spoke, their words could be seen too.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran found himself remembering the tales Old Nan had told him when he was a babe.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The ranger saved Sam and the girl from the wights, Bran said, hesitantly, and hes taking me to the three-eyed crow. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jojen coughed. Until we get there. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The water was frozen, and the snow had been falling for so long that Bran had lost count of the days, turning the lake into a vast white wilderness.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The elk went where he would, regardless of the wishes of Meera and Jojen on his back.

2016-07-07 00:50fileMostly he stayed beneath the trees, but where the shore curved away westward he would take the more direct path across the frozen lake, shouldering through snowdrifts taller than Bran as the ice crackled underneath his hooves.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran had come to dread that.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Meera halted them again. We should have come on the village by now. Her voice sounded hushed and strange.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Could we have passed it? Bran asked. I hope not.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSnow caked his legs almost to the knee, and Bran had felt him stagger more than once.
2016-07-07 00:50fileNo one was as strong as Hodor, no one.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Summer can find the village, Bran said suddenly, his words misting in the air.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe did not wait to hear what Meera might say, but closed his eyes and let himself flow from his broken body.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Ashes, < / emphasis > Bran thought, < emphasis > old and faint, but ashes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen he trotted toward the scent, Hodor lumbered after him at once.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe elk took longer to decide, so Bran returned reluctantly to his own body and said, That way.

2016-07-07 00:50fileBuried under drifts of snow, the round stone houses could just as easily have been boulders or hillocks or fallen logs, like the deadfall that Jojen had mistaken for a building the day before, until they dug down into it and found only broken branches and rotting logs.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > At least we will be out of the wind, Bran said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ho<emphasis > dor, < / emphasis > said Hodor.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Meera slid down from the elks back.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe and her brother helped lift Bran out of the wicker basket. Might be the wildlings left some food behind, she said.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnce Bran and Jojen and Hodor were safely settled, Meera fetched back some chunks of broken ice for them to suck on.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe melting water was so cold it made Bran shudder.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran could feel the big wolfs hunger, a shadow of his own. Go hunt, he told him, but you leave the elk alone. Part of him was wishing he could go hunting too.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Supper was a fistful of acorns, crushed and pounded into paste, so bitter that Bran gagged as he tried to keep it down.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJojen Reed did not even make the attempt.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jojen, you have to eat, Meera told him. Later.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI just want to rest. Jojen smiled a wan smile. This is not the day I die, sister.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe woods were full of frozen streams and cold black lakes, and Meera was as good a fisher with her three-pronged frog spear as most men were with hook and line.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt had been three days since Meera caught a fish, however.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > They departed Pentos by the Sunrise Gate, though Tyrion Lannister never glimpsed the sunrise. It will be as if you had never come to Pentos, my little friend, promised Magister Illyrio, as he drew shut the litters purple velvet drapes. No man must see you leave the city, as no man saw you enter. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Unsullied tell no tales, Illyrio assured him. And the galley that delivered you is on her way to Asshai even now.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The sea is hazardous, replied Illyrio. Autumn is a season rife with storms, and pirates still make their dens upon the Stepstones and venture forth to prey on honest men.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWe shall see the Rhoyne soon, and there you shall be rid of Illyrio and his big belly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Tyrion heard the < emphasis > thrum < / emphasis > of a crossbow once again, and wondered.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > How many days until we reach the river? he asked Illyrio that evening. At this pace, your queens dragons will be larger than Aegons three before I can lay eyes upon them. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileA large dragon is more fearsome than a small one. The magister shrugged. Much as it would please me to welcome Queen Daenerys to Volantis, I must rely on you and Griff for that.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tell me, Tyrion said as he drank, why should a magister of Pentos give three figs who wears the crown in Westeros?
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > If Daenerys is no more than a sweet young girl, the Iron Throne will cut her into sweet young pieces. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe blood of Aegon the Dragon flows in her veins. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Along with the blood of Aegon the Unworthy, Maegor the Cruel, and Baelor the Befuddled.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIf truth be told, I did not think Daenerys would survive for long amongst the horselords. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileSay rather that her brother Viserys gave her to Drogo to win the khals friendship.
2016-07-07 00:50fileViserys lusted for his fathers throne, but he lusted for Daenerys too, and was loath to give her up.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHad I not taken the precaution of posting guards upon her door, Viserys might have undone years of planning. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileDaenerys Daenerys is quite different. He popped a roasted lark into his mouth and crunched it noisily, bones and all. The frightened child who sheltered in my manse died on the Dothraki sea, and was reborn in blood and fire.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > By land or by sea, there are long leagues between Meereen and Volantis, Tyrion observed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion pondered all he knew of Volantis, oldest and proudest of the Nine Free Cities.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhy would the triarchs assist a queen who smashed the slave trade? He pointed at Illyrio. For that matter, why would you?
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhat do you hope to gain from Queen Daenerys? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou are a persistent little man. Illyrio gave a laugh and slapped his belly. As you will.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion snorted wine back up the scarred stump that had been his nose. My father would have loved to hear that. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Are you quite certain that Daenerys will make good her brothers promises? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She will, or she will not. Illyrio bit the egg in half. I told you, my little friend, not all that a man does is done for gain.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Liar, < / emphasis > thought Tyrion.
2016-07-07 00:50fileVarys spied on lesser thieves and took their takings.

2016-07-07 00:50fileSoon every man who had suffered a loss knew to come to me, whilst citys footpads and cutpurses sought out Varys half to slit his throat, the other half to sell him what theyd stolen.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWe both grew rich, and richer still when Varys trained his mice. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileVarys preferred orphan boys and young girls.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Secrets are worth more than silver or sapphires, < / emphasis > Varys claimed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Much of it, Tyrion admitted. I see that you are somewhat more than a cheesemonger after all. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Illyrio inclined his head. You are kind to say so, my little friend.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd for my part, I see that you are just as quick as Lord Varys claimed. He smiled, showing all his crooked yellow teeth, and shouted for another jar of Myrish fire wine.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When the magister drifted off to sleep with the wine jar at his elbow, Tyrion crept across the pillows to work it loose from its fleshy prison and pour himself a cup.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Tyrion was almost sorry that he had killed his father.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > If we eat this way every day I will be the size of Illyrio before I meet this dragon queen.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion listened to Illyrios snores, the creak of the leather straps, the slow < emphasis > clop clop < / emphasis > of the teams ironshod hooves on the hard Valyrian road, but his heart was listening for the beat of leathern wings.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion pulled the curtain back an inch to peer outside, but there was little to see but ochre fields, bare brown elms, and the road itself, a broad stone highway that ran straight as a spear to the horizon.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThough he said no word of complaint, his distress must have been plain to Illyrio Mopatis. Come, drink with me, the fat man said. A scale from the dragon that burned you, as they say. He poured for them from a flagon of blackberry wine so sweet that it drew more flies than honey.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion shooed them off with the back of his hand and drank deep.

2016-07-07 00:50fileEven so, he had no appetite, and when Illyrio offered him a bowl of blackberries in cream he waved it off. I dreamed about the queen, he said. I was on my knees before her, swearing my allegiance, but she mistook me for my brother, Jaime, and fed me to her dragons. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou are a clever imp, just as Varys said, and Daenerys will have need of clever men about her.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You flatter me. Illyrio waggled his hand. Alas, I am not made for travel, so I will send you to Daenerys in my stead.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDaenerys is not the fool her brother was.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Tyrion thought, smiling pleasantly.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion knew what he would find: not packed earth, nor bricks, nor cobbles, but a ribbon of fused stone raised a half foot above the ground to allow rainfall and snowmelt to run off its shoulders.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As they resumed their journey, Illyrio produced a bag of roasted chestnuts and began to speak once more of the dragon queen. Our last news of Queen Daenerys is old and stale, I fear.

Magister Illyrio twisted open a pot of garlic snails, sniffed at them, and smiled. At Volantis, you will have fresh tidings of Daenerys, we must hope, he said, as he sucked one from its shell. Dragons and young girls

My brothers could be relied upon to bring no shame upon House Lannister, his father had replied. Neither ever wed a whore. And when Tyrion had reminded him that in ten days he would be a man grown, free
