2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ive heard the food in hell is wretched. Tyrion glanced at the door, where a man had just come in: tall and stooped, his pointed beard dyed a splotchy purple.
2016-07-07 00:50fileFor half a heartbeat he thought he glimpsed Illyrio Mopatis, but it was only one of those white dwarf elephants passing the front door.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion shrugged. You never know who the wind might blow in.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion had just swallowed another locust.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHow much could he know of Griff and Aegon?
2016-07-07 00:50fileTurned them west instead of east, abandoning his hopes of wedding Queen Daenerys?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A sure cure for constipation, said Tyrion. Just ask my father. He reached for his tankard and took a slow swallow, to help conceal whatever might be showing on his face.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThank you. Ser Jorah slipped a coin into the girls palm and sent her on her way.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion frowned. Whose widow is this? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah stood. Watch and see.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion hopped down off his chair with a rattle of iron.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion did not fail to note how well chosen her customary table was; solid stone at her back, a leafy alcove to one side for entrances and exits, a perfect view of the inns front door, yet so steeped in shadow that she herself was nigh invisible.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Yes, < / emphasis > Tyrion wanted to say.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > No, Ser Jorah answered.

2016-07-07 00:50fileI brought you these. Ser Jorah produced his pair of gloves, and slapped them down on the table beside the other gifts the widow had received this morning: a silver goblet, an ornate fan carved of jade leaves so thin they were translucent, and an ancient bronze dagger marked with runes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion Lannisters world turned upside down.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe isnt selling me to Cersei.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHes giving me to Daenerys Targaryen.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > A guffaw burst from his lips, and suddenly Tyrion could not stop laughing.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion covered his mouth with his hands.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDust motes floated in the air as a serving girl filled two green glass cups for Ser Jorah and the widow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah scowled. If Doniphos is returned < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion twisted around for a look, hoping against hope that it was Duck and Haldon he was hearing.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And what do you think? Ser Jorah asked.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Good, < / emphasis > thought Tyrion.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Fool, < / emphasis > thought Tyrion.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhy would you seek Daenerys Targaryen, whom half the world wants dead? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jorah Mormonts face was dark with anger, but he answered. To serve her.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah hesitated. The dwarf is" < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > " I know who the dwarf is, and what he is. Her black eyes turned to Tyrion, hard as stone. Kinslayer, kingslayer, murderer, turncloak.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > My hate, < / emphasis > Tyrion wanted to say.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah started to rise, the widow snapped her fan closed, her scarred man slid out of the shadows and behind them a girl screamed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion spun just in time to see the dwarf rushing toward him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > For half a heartbeat Ser Jorah, the widow, and the scarred man stood still as stone.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion had to move both hands at once, but his chains had just enough give for him to reach the flagon on the table.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion rolled on one side as she buried the knife blade in the floorboards, yanked it free, raised it again < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > and suddenly she was rising off the floor, legs kicking wildly as she struggled in Ser Jorahs grasp. No! she wailed, in the Common Tongue of Westeros. Let < emphasis > go < / emphasis >! Tyrion heard her tunic rip as she fought to free herself.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion blinked up at the dripping girl twisting in the air. Why? he demanded. What did I ever do to you? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion felt a sudden shock of recognition.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > If they had half the wits of their pig, they would have fled Kings Landing the night Joff died, before Cersei could assign them some share of blame in her sons death.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Let her down, ser, he told Ser Jorah Mormont. She wont do us any harm. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah dumped the dwarf girl on the floor. I am sorry for your brother but we had no part in his murder. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion knew enough to understand that she was telling him to take the dwarf girl up to her rooms, give her wine, and find some clothes for her to wear.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When they were gone, the widow studied Tyrion, her black eyes shining. Monsters should be larger, it seems to me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You are too kind. Tyrion gave her his sweetest smile. Perhaps you would remove these charming iron bracelets as well?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > We will, said Tyrion, and thank you. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah frowned. Qarth is not our destination. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As you say. Tyrion grinned. If I were Volantene, and free, and had the blood, youd have my vote for triarch, my lady. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon swatted the bird away. The bastard boy is sending you out to range.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Alliser only said, You would like me to refuse.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I pray you do. Jon would never count Ser Alliser Thorne amongst his friends, but he was still a brother.

2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > They are all seasoned men, < / emphasis > Jon told himself but his uncle Benjen and his rangers had been seasoned men as well, and the haunted forest had swallowed them up without a trace.
2016-07-07 00:50fileNot for the first time, or the last, Jon Snow found himself wondering what had become of Benjen Stark.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon watched the riders go from atop the Wall" three parties, each of three men, each carrying a pair of ravens.
2016-07-07 00:50fileFrom on high their garrons looked no larger than ants, and Jon could not tell one ranger from another.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When the last of the riders had disappeared into the trees, Jon Snow rode the winch cage down with Dolorous Edd.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon could have reached through the bars and caught it if he had wished.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I had a frightening dream last night, mlord, Dolorous Edd confessed. You were my steward, fetching my food and cleaning up my leavings.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon did not smile. Your nightmare, my life. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon had sent ten of the Moles Town wildlings to each of them: green boys, old men, some wounded and infirm, but all capable of doing work of one sort or another.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDolorous Edd pushed open the door and hopped down, his boots breaking the crust of the last snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe song of steel on steel woke a hunger in Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt reminded him of warmer, simpler days, when he had been a boy at Winterfell matching blades with Robb under the watchful eye of Ser Rodrik Cassel.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Rodrik too had fallen, slain by Theon Turncloak and his ironmen as hed tried to retake Winterfell.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis blows would be a little slower. It will serve. Jon turned to face his foes. Come. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileIn the blink of an eye the boy had a boot on his chest and a swordpoint at his throat. War is never fair, Jon told him. Its two on one now, and youre dead. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileJon slammed his own shield into Emricks, and brought him down with a blow to the lower leg none too soon, because Arron was on him, with a crunching cut to the back of his thigh that sent him to one knee.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBy that time Jace had found his feet, so Jon put him down again. I hate it when dead men get up.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Rattleshirt was leaning against a wall.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You flatter yourself, Jon said. Aye, but Id flatten you. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileWe all do what we have to do, Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI want him in steel, not old bones. Once clad in mail and plate, the Lord of Bones seemed to stand a little straighter.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe seemed taller too, his shoulders thicker and more powerful than Jon would have thought.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Even Sam could appear almost formidable, clad head to heel in Donal Noyes steel.
2016-07-07 00:50fileInstead he asked for a two-handed sword. Theres a sweet sound, he said, slashing at the air. Flap closer, Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon rushed him hard.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Rattleshirt took a step backwards and met the charge with a two-handed slash.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIf Jon had not interposed his shield, it might have staved his breast-plate in and broken half his ribs.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Lord of Bones gave as good as he was getting.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > He cannot keep this up for long, < / emphasis > Jon told himself as he stopped another blow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon slashed at the wildlings face, and Rattleshirt pulled back his head.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon backed away.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Lord of Bones came after, chortling.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > He has no shield, < / emphasis > Jon reminded himself, < emphasis > and that monster swords too cumbersome for parries.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > It would have been a different fight if Jon had been armed with Longclaw, but < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon threw himself forward, bulling into the other man, and they went down together, legs entangled.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon lashed out with a mailed fist.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSomehow Rattleshirt ended up on top, with Jons head in his hands.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon struggled to one knee.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Next time you will, said Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDolorous Edd helped him to his feet and unbuckled his helm.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt had acquired several deep dents that had not been there when hed donned it. Release him. Jon tossed the helm to Hop-Robin, who dropped it.
2016-07-07 00:50fileRight there on his belt. < emphasis > There is always someone quicker and stronger, < / emphasis > Ser Rodrik had once told Jon and Robb.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Snow? a soft voice said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He turned to find Clydas standing beneath the broken archway, a parchment in his hand. From Stannis? Jon had been hoping for some word from the king.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon ripped off his gauntlet, took the letter, cracked the seal.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen he saw the signature, he forgot the battering Rattleshirt had given him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Ramsay Bolton, Lord of the Hornwood, < / emphasis > it read, in a huge, spiky hand.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe brown ink came away in flakes when Jon brushed it with his thumb.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon saw no reason not to tell him. Moat Cailin is taken.
2016-07-07 00:50fileRoose Bolton summons all leal lords to Barrowton, to affirm their loyalty to the Iron Throne and celebrate his sons wedding to His heart seemed to stop for a moment.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Snow? Clydas peered at him closely with his dim pink eyes. Are you unwell?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Hes to marry Arya Stark.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMy little sister. Jon could almost see her in that moment, long-faced and gawky, all knobby knees and sharp elbows, with her dirty face and tangled hair.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey would wash the one and comb the other, he did not doubt, but he could not imagine Arya in a wedding gown, nor Ramsay Boltons bed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > By now shed be eleven, < / emphasis > Jon thought.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnly you. Lady Catelyn would have rejoiced to hear those words, he knew.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon shook his head and walked away.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > By nightfall the bruises that Rattleshirt had given him had turned purple. Theyll go yellow before they fade away, he told Mormonts raven. Ill look as sallow as the Lord of Bones. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > It was Lady Melisandre and her followers at their nightfire.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > With Stannis and most of the queens men gone, her flock was much diminished; half a hundred of the free folk up from Moles Town, the handful of guards the king had left her, perhaps a dozen black brothers who had taken her red god for their own.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon felt as stiff as a man of sixty years.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > His thoughts kept returning to Arya.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Hed had Mikken make a sword for Arya once, a bravos blade, made small to fit her hand.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Snow, < / emphasis > muttered Lord Mormonts raven. <emphasis > Snow, snow.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He found Ghost outside his door, gnawing on the bone of an ox to get at the marrow. When did you get back? The direwolf got to his feet, abandoning the bone to come padding after Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI just need a breath of air. Jon stepped out into the night.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > My seat, < / emphasis > Jon Snow reflected.
2016-07-07 00:50fileFor half a heartbeat the night came alive with a thousand smells, and Jon Snow heard the crackle of the crust breaking on a patch of old snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When he turned he saw Ygritte.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe did not understand how he could have taken her for Ygritte.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMist rose from her nostrils, and from pale hands naked to the night. You will freeze your fingers off, Jon warned.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDo not despair, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Melisandre seemed amused. What is her name, this little sister that you do not have? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The thought made Jon uneasy. Best not. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Melisandre made the word a song.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon let out a white breath. He is not always so < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileWarmth calls to warmth, Jon Snow. Her eyes were two red stars, shining in the dark.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon had seen Ghosts eyes blazing red the same way, when they caught the light just right. <emphasis > Ghost, < / emphasis > he called. To me. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon frowned in disbelief. Thats queer. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I can show you. Melisandre draped one slender arm over Ghost, and the direwolf licked her face. The Lord of Light in his wisdom made us male and female, two parts of a greater whole.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou should look behind you, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon glanced over his shoulder.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon could feel her warmth.
2016-07-07 00:50fileVals sister, Mance Rayders wife.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A wise woman. Melisandre rose, her red robes stirring in the wind. A sword without a hilt is still a sword, though, and a sword is a fine thing to have when foes are all about.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHear me now, Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > DAVOS < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even in the gloom of the Wolfs Den, Davos Seaworth could sense that something was awry this morning.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Every night Davos went to sleep with those words in his head, and every morn he woke to them.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDead man was his name for Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIts her wholl take your head and hands, when Lord Wyman sends down word. Davos had never seen a bigger axe than Lady Lu, nor one with a sharper edge.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I will not plead for mercy, < / emphasis > Davos resolved.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDavos rose and paced his cell.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe floor was made of warped planks full of splinters, and his sleeping pallet smelled of mildew, but those discomforts were mild compared to what Davos had expected.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDavos had furs to keep him warm by night, wood to feed his fire, clean clothing, a greasy tallow candle.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAside from his keepers, Davos Seaworth had the Wolfs Den to himself.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The rest of us consisted of a cook Davos never saw, six guardsmen in the ground-floor barracks, a pair of washerwomen, and the two turnkeys who looked after the prisoner.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > His years as a smuggler had given Davos Seaworth a sense of when a man was wrong, and Garth was wrong.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMost such favors were granted, and Davos was duly grateful.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Neither man would speak about Lord Manderly or King Stannis or the Freys, but they would talk of other things.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSome nights the boy would even bring a skin of wine to the cell and ask Davos about the smugglers life as they drank.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Den was much older than White Harbor, the knight told Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt had been raised by King Jon Stark to defend the mouth of the White Knife against raiders from the sea.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos could not argue with the truth of that.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDavos sat beside his candle and looked at the letters he had scratched out word by word during the days of his confinement.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShould Stannis lose his war, our lands will be lost as well.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShould Stannis gain the Iron Throne, House Seaworth will survive and Devan will remain at court.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHis notes to Steffon and young Stannis were short and stiff and awkward; if truth be told, he did not know them half as well as he had his older boys, the ones whod burned or drowned upon the Blackwater.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos shuffled through the letters slowly, reading each one over several times, wondering whether he should change a word here or add one there.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos eyed the stranger warily.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt was and is, thanks to your King Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMuch and more has happened whilst you have been confined within these walls, Lord Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMoat Cailin has fallen, and Roose Bolton has returned to the north with Ned Starks younger daughter.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe demands homage and hostages and witnesses to the wedding of Arya Stark and his bastard Ramsay Snow, by which match the Boltons mean to lay claim to Winterfell.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos rose to his feet. If I should die, I beseech my lord to see that my letters are delivered. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen it was blazing red and hot, he took Davos down more steps into a barrel-vaulted cellar where the weeping walls were crusted white with salt, and seawater sloshed beneath their feet with every step.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey passed through several cellars, and rows of small, damp, foul-smelling cells very different from the room where Davos had been confined.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Where are we? asked Davos as they climbed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Davos climbed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDavos could hear pipes and fiddles playing, not far away.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Beneath the music, Davos could hear the murmur of many voices, the clatter of cups and platters.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Davos, you will not know, but you are dead. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Robett Glover filled a wine cup and offered it to Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos shifted uncomfortably.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou have a common face, Lord Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > My lord should take up a life of mummery, said Davos. You and yours were most convincing.

2016-07-07 00:50fileNot every man has it in him to be Prince Aemon the Dragonknight or Symeon Star-Eyes, and not every woman can be as brave as my Wylla and her sister Wynafryd who < emphasis > did < / emphasis > know, yet played her own part fearlessly.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Tywin Lannister wrote me himself to say that he had Wylis.

2016-07-07 00:50fileIf I would have him freed unharmed, he told me, I must repent my treason, yield my city, declare my loyalty to the boy king on the Iron Throne and bend my knee to Roose Bolton, his Warden of the North.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMayhaps Tywin Lannister was one such.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere the matter stood when Tywin died.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You took a great risk, my lord, Davos said. If the Freys had seen through your deception < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos felt a shiver up his spine. I see. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Three, < / emphasis > thought Davos, < emphasis > though I fathered seven.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou saw them, the arrogant Ser Jared and his nephew Rhaegar, that smirking worm who wears a dragons name.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIf Stannis wonders that my letters say so little, it is because I dare not even trust my maester.
2016-07-07 00:50fileFoes and false friends are all around me, Lord Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI drink with Jared, jape with Symond, promise Rhaegar the hand of my own beloved granddaughter but never think that means I have forgotten.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe north remembers, Lord Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Something about the way Lord Wyman said that chilled Davos to the bone. If it is justice that you want, my lord, look to King Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Robett Glover broke in to add, Your loyalty does you honor, my lord, but Stannis Baratheon remains your king, not our own. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your own king is dead, Davos reminded them, murdered at the Red Wedding beside Lord Wymans son. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Was it possible that one of Robb Starks brothers had survived the ruin of Winterfell?
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The north would rise for either, he suspected but Stannis Baratheon would never make common cause with an imposter.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBeneath a tangle of dark brown hair his face was almost feral, with a wide mouth, sharp nose, and pointed chin. Who are you? Davos asked.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe was Theon Greyjoys squire.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWex was at Winterfell. Glover sat. How much does Lord Stannis know of what transpired at Winterfell? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos thought back on the tales theyd heard. Winterfell was captured by Theon Greyjoy, who had once been Lord Starks ward.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt was the Bastard of Bolton who put Winterfell to the sword Ramsay Snow, he was called then, before the boy king made him a Bolton.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSnow did not kill them all.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos paled. Gods be good.
2016-07-07 00:50fileA < emphasis > Snow, < / emphasis > no matter what the boy king says. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt is said she ate her own fingers in her extremity and the Lannister notion of kings justice is to reward her killer with Ned Starks little girl. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey speak of wargs and skinchangers and assert that it was Robb Stark who slew my Wendel.
2016-07-07 00:50fileRoose Bolton lies about his part in the Red Wedding, and his bastard lies about the fall of Winterfell.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And now, my lord? asked Davos.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He had hoped to hear Lord Wyman say, < emphasis > And now I shall declare for King Stannis, < / emphasis > but instead the fat man smiled an odd, twinkling smile and said, And now I have a wedding to attend.
2016-07-07 00:50fileRoose Bolton wants me on my knees, and beneath the velvet courtesy he shows the iron mail.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI can deliver King Stannis the allegiance of all the lands east of the White Knife, from Widows Watch and Ramsgate to the Sheepshead Hills and the headwaters of the Broken Branch.
2016-07-07 00:50fileNot Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Robett Glover took up the tale. We may never know all that happened at Winterfell, when Ser Rodrik Cassel tried to take the castle back from Theon Greyjoys ironmen.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos thought about that. The old gods saved him? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Six of them, asked Davos. There were six. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Two of them Ned Starks murdered sons. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Davos understood. You want the boy. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileThat is my price, Lord Davos.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSmuggle me back my liege lord, and I will take Stannis Baratheon as my king. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Old instinct made Davos Seaworth reach for his throat.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Where is the boy? Somehow Davos knew he would not like the answer. Where is it you want me to go, my lord? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > For half a heartbeat Davos considered asking Wyman Manderly to send him back to the Wolfs Den, to Ser Bartimus with his tales and Garth with his lethal ladies.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > DAENERYS < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Those ships are strangling us, and all my admiral can do is talk of dragons, Dany said. You < emphasis > are < / emphasis > my admiral, are you not? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > His bitterness dismayed her, so much so that Dany found herself wondering if the grizzled Pentoshi could be one of her three betrayers.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Barristan remained. Our stores are ample for the moment, he reminded her, and Your Grace has planted beans and grapes and wheat.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI should like that. Viserys had told her stories of the tourneys he had witnessed in the Seven Kingdoms, but Dany had never seen a joust herself.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I hope that day comes quickly. She would have kissed her good knight on the cheek, but just then Missandei appeared beneath the arched doorway. Missandei? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileDany did not share his belief.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt would have been pleasant to think that all the deaths were the work of a single enemy who might be caught and killed, but Dany suspected that the truth was otherwise.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > You may continue to watch Hizdahr zo Loraq, but no harm is to come to him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany studied the scroll.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI have to hope for peace. Dany held the parchment above a candle and watched the names go up in flame, while Skahaz glowered at her.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd Rhaegar < / emphasis > died.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When she descended to the purple marble hall, she found it almost empty. Are there no petitioners today? Dany asked Reznak mo Reznak. No one who craves justice or silver for a sheep? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Grey Worm began the tale. He came out of the morning mists, a rider on a pale horse, dying.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She is burning, Daenerys repeated. Who is < emphasis > she < / emphasis >? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > His horse was bleeding, Grey Worm said. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A sign of what? asked Dany. A sign of wroth and ruin. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany rose abruptly. I thank you for your counsel and for all that you did for this poor man. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileRecall Brown Ben and the Second Sons as well. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen Ser Barristan told her that her captain desired words with her, she thought for a moment that it was Daario, and her heart leapt.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut the captain that he spoke of was Brown Ben Plumm.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Brown Ben had a seamed and weathered face, skin the color of old teak, white hair, and wrinkles at the corners of his eyes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany was so pleased to see his leathery brown face that she hugged him.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHis eyes crinkled in amusement. I heard talk Your Grace was going to take a husband, he said, but no one told me it was me. They laughed together as Reznak sputtered, but the laughter ceased when Brown Ben said, We caught three Astapori.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Daenerys received them in the grandeur of her hall as tall candles burned amongst the marble pillars.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > He sent for me, < / emphasis > thought Dany.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Others blamed Daenerys, said the weaver, but more of us still loved you. She is on her way, we said to one another. She is coming at the head of a great host, with food for all. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > I left you with a council to rule over you, < / emphasis > Dany thought, < emphasis > a healer, a scholar, and a priest.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Theres more coming, Brown Ben announced when the Astapori had been led away. These three had horses.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Brown Ben shrugged. Hundreds.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I wouldnt, said Brown Ben Plumm. Im no maester, mind you, but I know you got to keep the bad apples from the good. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > These are not apples, Ben, said Dany. These are men and women, sick and hungry and afraid. < emphasis > My children.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace could not have saved them, said Ser Barristan. You warned King Cleon against this war with Yunkai.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Brown Ben Plumm was puzzled. Who is Eroeh? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Silence, < / emphasis > said Daenerys. We will not speak of that. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany sighed. I am sorry, Ben.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThats good. Daenerys looked at the faces of the men around her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Barristan, with his lined face and sad blue eyes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBrown Ben, white-haired, grizzled, tough as old leather.
2016-07-07 00:50fileGrey Worm, smooth-cheeked, stolid, expressionless.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Barristan disagreed. I do not think we should allow them to invest us.

2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Barristan will see to it. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Buy them, why not? Dany said.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany looked at him helplessly.
2016-07-07 00:50fileGo and do as Ive commanded you. Dany rose, brushed past Brown Ben, and climbed the steps to the sweet solitude of her terrace.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > MELISANDRE < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis was marching south into peril, the king who carried the fate of the world upon his shoulders, Azor Ahai reborn.

2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Stannis?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Death, < / emphasis > thought Melisandre.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The flames crackled softly, and in their crackling she heard the whispered name < emphasis > Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMelisandre had seen his danger before, had tried to warn the boy of it.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Whenever she was asked what she saw within her fires, Melisandre would answer, Much and more, but seeing was never as simple as those words suggested.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMelisandre had practiced her art for years beyond count, and she had paid the price.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I pray for a glimpse of Azor Ahai, and Rhllor shows me only Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Thank you. Melisandre took a sip, swallowed, and gave the boy a smile.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe lad had taken great pride in serving as a kings squire, and it had wounded him when Stannis commanded him to remain at Castle Black.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > In truth, he was here because Melisandre had asked for him.

2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Davos would not thank her for it, no more than the boy himself, but it seemed to her that Seaworth had suffered enough grief.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMisguided as he was, his loyalty to Stannis could not be doubted.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis had left a dozen of his men behind to serve her when he marched south, but most of them were useless.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThree of her guard were geldings that Stannis had castrated for raping wildling women.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Having guards about her would no doubt help keep the black brothers properly respectful, the red priestess knew, but none of the men that Stannis had given her were like to be much help should she find herself in peril.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMelisandre of Asshai did not fear for herself.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Melisandre had spent the night in her chair by the fire, as she often did.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWith Stannis gone, her bed saw little use.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOne day, Melisandre prayed, she would not sleep at all.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The wooden man she had glimpsed, though, and the boy with the wolfs face they were his servants, surely his champions, as Stannis was hers.

2016-07-07 00:50fileBowen turned red and made some choking sounds, but that was as far as it went. The wildling sat on the edge of the window, slid his dagger from its sheath. If some crow wants to slip a knife between my ribs whilst Im spooning up some supper, hes welcome to try.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe liked Tormund, and the old fraud liked him too.

His huge white direwolf prowled around the shafts, sniffing, then lifted his leg and pissed on the spear that held the head of Black Jack Bulwer. Ghost would have their scent if they were still out there. < / p >

Barbrey Dustin is my second wifes younger sister, Rodrik Ryswells daughter, sister to Roger, Rickard, and mine own namesake, Roose, cousin to the other Ryswells.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion was not entirely sure he had been japing.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion squatted across from him and warmed his hands against the nights chill.
2016-07-07 00:50fileNo doubt that was one reason the high priest Benerro had chosen him to bring the faith of Rhllor to Daenerys Targaryen. Dragons old and young, true and false, bright and dark.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAn amiable fellow like me? Tyrion was almost flattered.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Not me, said Tyrion. For me, it is all about the olives.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion gave a crooked grin. I believe I will stay with < emphasis > Stinky.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The quarters he shared with Ser Jorah were a cabin only by courtesy; the dank, dark, foul-smelling closet had barely enough space to hang a pair of sleeping hammocks, one above the other.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe found Mormont stretched out in the lower one, swaying slowly with the motion of the ship. The girl finally poked her nose abovedecks, Tyrion told him. One look at me and she scurried right back down below. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Jorah sat up in his hammock. Befriend her, then.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No. Tyrion bristled. I have sins enough to answer for; Ill have no part of this one.
2016-07-07 00:50fileInnocent as a lamb. Ser Jorah got to his feet. The dwarf girl is your burden.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIts naught to me. He shouldered past Tyrion and out of the cabin.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Twice exiled, and small wonder, < / emphasis > Tyrion thought.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Ser Jorah spent most of his waking hours pacing the forecastle or leaning on the rail, gazing out to sea.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLooking for Daenerys, willing the ship to sail faster.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > On the river Tyrion had to endure Griff, but there had at least been the mystery of the captains true identity to divert him and the more congenial companionship of the rest of the poleboats little company.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Life aboard the < emphasis > Selaesori Qhoran < / emphasis > was nothing if not tedious, Tyrion had found.

2016-07-07 00:50fileLeaving Volantis, the cog had sailed within sight of land at first, so Tyrion could gaze at passing headlands, watch clouds of seabirds rise from stony cliffs and crumbling watchtowers, count bare brown islands as they slipped past.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion slept badly at the best of times, and this was far from that.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThat left him with the beggars choice of climbing up into his hammock and listening to Jorah Mormont snore beneath him, or remaining abovedecks to contemplate the sea.

2016-07-07 00:50fileDark and deep and forbidding, beautiful in a chilly sort of way, but when he looked at it too long Tyrion found himself musing on how easy it would be to slip over the gunwale and drop down into that darkness.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAs much as Tyrion enjoyed sniggering at that, he had come to prefer taking his meals alone.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion had finished them all by their third day at sea.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTheres little enough aboard this ship. Tyrion closed the book. Come.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Do you mean to spend your whole life running away? Tyrion asked before she could slip back out the door.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > They would have laughed at me, said Tyrion.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I am sorry about your brother. Tyrion had said the same words to her before, back in Volantis, but she was so far gone in grief back there that he doubted she had heard them.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The accusation stung, coming so hard on the heels of Jorah Mormonts words. His blood is on my sisters hands, and the hands of the brutes who killed him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMy hands Tyrion turned them over, inspected them, coiled them into fists. my hands are crusted with old blood, aye.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion Lannister had scant experience with other dwarfs.

2016-07-07 00:50fileGrowing up, Tyrion heard reports of a dwarf jester at the seat of the Dornish Lord Fowler, a dwarf maester in service on the Fingers, and a female dwarf amongst the silent sisters, but he never felt the least need to seek them out.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen he asked politely if she were referring to herself, Cersei had thrown a cup of wine in his face.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Tyrion mopped at his face with a sleeve.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion remembered the storm hed suffered crossing the narrow sea, the way the deck had jumped beneath his feet, the hideous creaking sounds the ship had made, the taste of wine and vomit. No-Nose will stay up here. If the gods wanted him, he would sooner die by drowning than choking on his own vomit.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion was underfoot amid-ships, so he climbed the forecastle and hunkered down, savoring the lash of cold rain on his cheeks.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > By the time the storm broke, evening was upon them and Tyrion Lannister was soaked through to the smallclothes, yet somehow he felt elated and even more so later, when he found a drunken Jorah Mor-mont in a pool of vomit in their cabin.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion won the first, then lost the other two.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He found Penny on the forecastle, where he had so often found Ser Jorah, standing by the rail beside the cogs hideous half-rotted figurehead and gazing out across the inky sea.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tyrion thought it best to leave her undisturbed, but it was too late.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I understand. He found himself thinking of Jaime.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Tyrion tried not to wince. Hes dead now, Penny went on. My mother too.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > No, < / emphasis > thought Tyrion.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Thats because they have never seen a dwarf before, in their wretched pisspot towns, < / emphasis > Tyrion thought.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Unless Daenerys decides she needs some Lannister blood, to pay for the Targaryen blood my brother shed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe next day Tyrion encountered her and her spotted sow amidships in midafternoon, when the air was warm and the sea calm. Her name is Pretty, the girl told him, shyly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Penny gave Tyrion some acorns, and he let Pretty eat them from his hand.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > The fingers, < / emphasis > Tyrion called them; they were men of the Fiery Hand, after all, and there were five of them.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > To atone for that Tyrion made an attempt to teach her < emphasis > cyvasse, < / emphasis > though he soon realized that was a lost cause. No, he said, a dozen times, the dragon flies, not the elephants. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Back in the cabin he shared with Jorah Mormont, Tyrion twisted in his hammock for hours, slipping in and out of sleep.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion had never seen a bigger moon.

2016-07-07 00:50fileGerion Lannister had set sail for Valyria when Tyrion was eighteen, intent on recovering the lost ancestral blade of House Lannister and any other treasures that might have survived the Doom.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion had wanted desperately to go with them, but his lord father had dubbed the voyage a fools quest, and forbidden him to take part.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe men Lord Tywin sent to seek after him had traced his course as far as Volantis, where half his crew had deserted him and he had bought slaves to replace them.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOthers seek Daenerys too. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion considered saying something, then thought better.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran and Meera made up names for those who sang the song of earth: Ash and Leaf and Scales, Black Knife and Snowylocks and Coals.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnly she could speak the Common Tongue, so what the others thought of their new names Bran never learned.

2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen Meera Reed had asked him his true name, he made a ghastly sound that might have been a chuckle. I wore many names when I was quick, but even I once had a mother, and the name she gave me at her breast was Brynden. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I have an uncle Brynden, Bran said. Hes my mothers uncle, really.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBrynden Blackfish, hes called. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnly the trees remember. His voice was so soft that Bran had to strain to hear.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Most of him has gone into the tree, explained the singer Meera called Leaf. He has lived beyond his mortal span, and yet he lingers.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > What will I know? Bran asked the Reeds afterward, when they came with torches burning brightly in their hand, to carry him back to a small chamber off the big cavern where the singers had made beds for them to sleep. What do the trees remember? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The secrets of the old gods, said Jojen Reed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > So will you, said Meera.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThat made Bran sad.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe was almost a man grown, and he did not want Meera to think he was some weepy babe. Maybe you could be greenseers too, he said instead.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No, Bran. Now Meera sounded sad. It is given to a few to drink of that green fountain whilst still in mortal flesh, to hear the whisperings of the leaves and see as the trees see, as the gods see, said Jojen. Most are not so blessed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileUnder the hill, Jojen brooded, Meera fretted, and Hodor wandered through dark tunnels with a sword in his right hand and a torch in his left.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOr was it Bran wandering?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The singers made Bran a throne of his own, like the one Lord Brynden sat, white weirwood flecked with red, dead branches woven through living roots.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran did not oft range with them in those days, but some nights he watched them from above.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt flew to him and landed on his arm, and Bran stroked its feathers and slipped inside of it again.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Old Nan had told him the same story once, Bran remembered, but when he asked Robb if it was true, his brother laughed and asked him if he believed in grumkins too.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe wished Robb were with them now.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI bet that he could learn to fly too, him and Arya and Sansa, even baby Rickon and Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSome days Bran wondered if all of this wasnt just some dream.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Only one man in a thousand is born a skinchanger, Lord Brynden said one day, after Bran had learned to fly, and only one skinchanger in a thousand can be a greenseer. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I thought the greenseers were the wizards of the children, Bran said. The singers, I mean. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran did not understand, so he asked the Reeds. Do you like to read books, Bran? Jojen asked him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMy sister Sansa likes the kissing stories, but those are stupid. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No, Meera said. Jojen, youre scaring him. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileJojen thought it might be squirrel meat, and Meera said that it was rat.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran did not care.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey sang in True Tongue, so Bran could not understand the words, but their voices were as pure as winter air. Where are the rest of you? Bran asked Leaf, once.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She seemed sad when she said it, and that made Bran sad as well.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > One day Meera and Jojen decided to go see the river, despite Leafs cautions. I want to come too, Bran said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Meera gave him a mournful look.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran remembered a time when no one could climb as good as him, not even Robb or Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLike a dog who has had all the fight whipped out of him, Hodor would curl up and hide whenever Bran reached out for him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis hiding place was somewhere deep within him, a pit where not even Bran could touch him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > No one wants to hurt you, Hodor, < / emphasis > he said silently, to the child-man whose flesh hed taken.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran only had to smile, do as he was told, and mutter Hodor from time to time, and he could follow Meera and Jojen, grinning happily, without anyone suspecting it was really him.

2016-07-07 00:50fileJojen made it down the rope easily enough, but after Meera caught a blind white fish with her frog spear and it was time to climb back up, his arms began to tremble and he could not make it to the top, so they had to tie the rope around him and let Hodor haul him up. Hodor, he grunted every time he gave a pull. Hodor, hodor, hodor. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran ate with Summer and his pack, as a wolf.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAs Hodor he explored the caves.

2016-07-07 00:50fileMost of them looked dead to him, but as he crossed in front of them their eyes would open and follow the light of his torch, and one of them opened and closed a wrinkled mouth as if he were trying to speak. Hodor, Bran said to him, and he felt the real Hodor stir down in his pit.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The thought filled Bran with dread.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I was going to be a knight, < / emphasis > Bran remembered.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnly Bran the broken boy, Brandon of House Stark, prince of a lost kingdom, lord of a burned castle, heir to ruins.
2016-07-07 00:50fileUnder the hill, Jojen Reed grew ever more sullen and solitary, to his sisters distress.

2016-07-07 00:50fileShe would often sit with Bran beside their little fire, talking of everything and nothing, petting Summer where he slept between them, whilst her brother wandered the caverns by himself.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJojen had even taken to climbing up to the caves mouth when the day was bright.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He wants to go home, Meera told Bran. He will not even try and fight his fate.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Hes being brave, said Bran.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Hes being stupid, Meera said. Id hoped that when we found your three-eyed crow now I wonder why we ever came. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > For me, < / emphasis > Bran thought. His greendreams, he said. His greendreams. Meeras voice was bitter. Hodor, said Hodor.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Meera began to cry.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran hated being crippled then. Dont cry, he said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Hodor could hold her and pat her on the back.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The thought made Bran feel strange, but he was still thinking it when Meera bolted from the fire, back out into the darkness of the tunnels.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe beckoned, and another of the singers padded forward, the white-haired one that Meera had named Snowy locks.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe handed Bran a wooden spoon.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Something about the look of it made Bran feel ill.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran did want to be married to a tree but who else would wed a broken boy like him?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bran closed his eyes and slipped free of his skin.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Eddard Stark sat upon a rock beside the deep black pool in the gods wood, the pale roots of the heart tree twisting around him like an old mans gnarled arms.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Winterfell, < / emphasis > Bran whispered.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > His father looked up. Whos there? he asked, turning and Bran, frightened, pulled away.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tell us what you saw. From far away Leaf looked almost a girl, no older than Bran or one of his sisters, but close at hand she seemed far older.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I < emphasis > saw < / emphasis > him. Bran could feel rough wood pressing against one cheek. He was cleaning Ice. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A man must know how to look before he can hope to see, said Lord Brynden. Those were shadows of days past that you saw, Bran.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > But, said Bran, he < emphasis > heard < / emphasis > me. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileI have my own ghosts, Bran.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When? Bran wanted to know. In a year, or three, or ten.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Hodor carried Bran back to his chamber, muttering Hodor in a low voice as Leaf went before them with a torch.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe had hoped that Meera and Jojen would be there, so he could tell them what he had seen, but their snug alcove in the rock was cold and empty.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHodor eased Bran down onto his bed, covered him with furs, and made a fire for them.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Watching the flames, Bran decided he would stay awake till Meera came back.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJojen would be unhappy, he knew, but Meera would be glad for him, He did not remember closing his eyes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Eddard seemed much younger this time.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Eddard Stark lifted his head and looked long at the weirwood, frowning, but he did not speak.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > He cannot see me, < / emphasis > Bran realized, despairing.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Eddard Stark resumed his prayer.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBran felt his eyes fill up with tears.
2016-07-07 00:50fileEddard Stark dissolved, like mist in a morning sun.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Arya!
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Bran thought eagerly, as he watched her leap up onto a rock and cut at the boy.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIf the girl was Arya, the boy was Bran himself, and he had never worn his hair so long.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > And Arya never beat me playing swords, the way that girl is beating him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > After that the glimpses came faster and faster, till Bran was feeling lost and dizzy.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe saw no more of his father, nor the girl who looked like Arya, but a woman heavy with child emerged naked and dripping from the black pool, knelt before the tree, and begged the old gods for a son who would avenge her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThen there came a brown-haired girl slender as a spear who stood on the tips of her toes to kiss the lips of a young knight as tall as Hodor.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd now the lords Bran glimpsed were tall and hard, stern men in fur and chain mail.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No, said Bran, <emphasis > no, dont, < / emphasis > but they could not hear him, no more than his father had.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Seven hundred feet up, Jon Snow stood looking down upon the haunted forest.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Have Emmett assemble his recruits, he told Dolorous Edd. Well want an escort.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon smiled. Some had best not say so in my presence. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe wind was gusting, cold as the breath of the ice dragon in the tales Old Nan had told when Jon was a boy.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Glass, < / emphasis > Jon mused, < emphasis > might be of use here.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen he saw Jon he bounded back onto his feet and shook himself off.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDolorous Edd said, Hes going with you? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileEdd was still saddling the grey when Bowen Marsh stomped across the yard to confront Jon at the stables. My lord, I wish you would reconsider.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Unwise, said Jon, but necessary.
2016-07-07 00:50fileEven Benjen Stark, your own uncle, he" < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I have something they did not. Jon turned his head and whistled. <emphasis > Ghost.

2016-07-07 00:50fileGhost stalked beside Jons horse as the rangers and recruits formed up, then stopped and sniffed, his breath frosting in the air. What is it? Jon asked. Is someone there? The woods were empty as far as he could see, but that was not very far.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon did not fear for the direwolf so much as for any wildlings he might encounter.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon put his heels into his horse.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon sent Tom Barleycorn ahead to scout for them, though the way to the white grove was oft trod and familiar.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon could not speak for what they might have been before they reached the Wall, but he did not doubt that most had pasts as black as their cloaks.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon knew them, though.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThey had been two of the sixty-three wildlings who had followed Jon Snow back to the Wall the day he made his appeal, so far the only two to decide they wanted a black cloak.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe and Jon and Bowen Marsh had weighed each man in turn and assigned him to an order: Leathers, Jax, and Emrick to the rangers, Horse to the builders, Arron and Satin to the stewards.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Iron Emmett rode at the head of the column, mounted on the ugliest horse Jon had ever seen, a shaggy beast that looked to be all hair and hooves. Talk is there was some trouble at Harlots Tower last night, the master-at-arms said.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon had housed them in the same abandoned tower where he had once slept when he had been new to the Wall.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon was not about to condone the mockery. Three drunken fools mistook Hardins for a brothel, thats all.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And who will guard the guards? < emphasis > You know nothing, Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > He had learned, though, and Ygritte had been his teacher.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > A man can own a woman, and a man can own a knife, < / emphasis > Ygritte had told him once, < emphasis > but no man can own both.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Bowen Marsh had not been all wrong.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHardins Tower was tinder waiting for a spark. I mean to open three more castles, Jon said. Deep Lake, Sable Hall, and the Long Barrow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon laughed. Have no fear, you wont be alone.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI mean to give you Dolorous Edd as your second and your steward. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Trouble is the lord commanders lot, < / emphasis > Jon might have said.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere were nights when Jon Snow wondered if he had not made a grievous mistake by preventing Stannis from marching all the wildlings off to be slaughtered.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > I know nothing, Ygritte, < / emphasis > he thought, < emphasis > and perhaps I never will.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon pulled his scarf up over his mouth and nose and raised the hood on his cloak. Not far now, he told the men.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon smelled Tom Barleycorn before he saw him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOf late, Jon Snow sometimes felt as if he and the direwolf were one, even awake.
2016-07-07 00:50fileA few moments later Tom was there. Wildlings, he told Jon, softly. In the grove. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon brought the riders to a halt. How many? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon was not of a mind to fall back to the Wall, however.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow reached back and pulled Longclaw from his sheath.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIn the deepening glow their eyes looked black, but in daylight they would be blood-red, Jon knew.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnly one of them reacted when Jon stepped from the brush.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon grabbed the wolf by the scruff of the neck. We want no battle here. His men could bring the giant down, he knew, but not without cost.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon Snow was about to reach for Longclaw when Leathers spoke, from the far side of the grove.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis words sounded gruff and guttural, but Jon heard the music in it and recognized the Old Tongue.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt sounded like growling, interspersed with grunts, and Jon could not understand a word of it.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe six who remained included a mother and child, two old men, a wounded Thenn in battered bronze, and one of the Hornfoot folk, his bare feet so badly frostbitten that Jon knew at a glance he would never walk again.

2016-07-07 00:50fileMost had been strangers to one another when they came to the grove, he learned subsequently; when Stannis broke Mance Rayders host, they had fled into the woods to escape the carnage, wandered for a time, lost friends and kin to cold and starvation, and finally washed up here, too weak and weary to go on. The gods are here, one of the old men said. This was as good a place to die as any.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The Wall is only a few hours south of here, said Jon. Why not seek shelter there?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even Mance hisself, the woman added.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Melisandre, < / emphasis > Jon thought, < emphasis > you and your red god have much and more to answer for.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Commander of the Nights Watch, and a son of Eddard Stark of Winterfell. Jon turned to Tom Barleycorn. Have Rory and Pate bring up the horses.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon Snow sank to one knee in the snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd Arya too, my little sister, wherever she might be.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI pray you, let Mance find her and bring her safe to me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Gods of the wood, grant me the strength to do the same, < / emphasis > Jon Snow prayed silently.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I am the sword in the darkness, said the six, and it seemed to Jon as though their voices were changing, growing stronger, more certain. I am the watcher on the walls.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Ghost nuzzled up against his shoulder, and Jon draped an arm around him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon Snow was the first onto his feet. Rise now as men of the Nights Watch. He gave Horse a hand to pull him up.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > They did the same with the two corpses, to the puzzlement of Iron Emmett. They will only slow us, my lord, he said to Jon. We should chop them up and burn them. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No, said Jon. Bring them.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon glimpsed the red wanderer above, watching them through the leafless branches of great trees as they made their way beneath.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe best time to steal a woman was when the Thief was in the Moonmaid, Ygritte had always claimed.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAt the gate, they had to wait a few moments before Dolorous Edd Tollett appeared to slide back the bolts and swing open the iron bars.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon took Leathers aside. Take charge of him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The living wildlings Jon sent off to have their wounds and frostbites tended.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Clydas had come and gone, Jon noted as he was hanging his cloak on the peg beside the door.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon cracked the hardened wax, flattened the roll of parchment, read.

2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > A small mercy, < / emphasis > thought Tyrion.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Nearby midnight the winds finally died away, and the sea grew calm enough for Tyrion to make his way back up onto deck.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Asha Greyjoy rode in the baggage train, in a covered wayn with two huge iron-rimmed wheels, fettered at wrist and ankle and watched over day and night by a She-Bear who snored worse than any man.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis Grace King Stannis was taking no chances on his prize escaping captivity.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Robert would have done it in ten, Asha heard Lord Fell boasting.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHis grandsire had been slain by Robert at Summerhall; somehow this had elevated his slayer to godlike prowess in the grandsons eyes. Robert would have been inside Winterfell a fortnight ago, thumbing his nose at Bolton from the battlements. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Best not mention that to Stannis, suggested Justin Massey, or hell have us marching nights as well as days. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > This king lives in his brothers shadow, < / emphasis > Asha thought.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSomething was broken down inside, Asha did not doubt.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe who will not kneel stays dead, stiff legs and all. Balon Greyjoy had proved the truth of his own words when his first rebellion failed; the kraken bent the knee to stag and direwolf, only to rise again when Robert Baratheon and Eddard Stark were dead.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis had given her their lives.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMen said he was just and if his was a harsh, hard-handed sort of justice, well, life on the Iron Islands had accustomed Asha Greyjoy to that.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt might matter some to the wretched ruin of a husband that Euron had inflicted upon her, but Eric Ironmaker did not have coin enough to ransom her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut there was no explaining such things to Stannis Baratheon.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > There was only one woman that Stannis listened to, and he had left her on the Wall. Though I would sooner she was with us, confessed Ser Justin Massey, the fair-haired knight who commanded the baggage train. The last time we went into battle without Lady Melisandre was the Blackwater, when Lord Renlys shade came down upon us and drove half our host into the bay. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The last time? Asha said. Was this sorceress at Deepwood Motte?
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd Roose Bolton has as many men as we do. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Or more, < / emphasis > thought Asha.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even prisoners have ears, and she had heard all the talk at Deepwood Motte, when King Stannis and his captains were debating this march.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Justin had opposed it from the start, along with many of the knights and lords who had come with Stannis from the south.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut the wolves insisted; Roose Bolton could not be suffered to hold Winterfell, and the Neds girl must be rescued from the clutches of his bastard.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > And die by the thousands, < / emphasis > Asha thought. We might do best to winter here, suggested Lord Peasebury. <emphasis > Winter < / emphasis > here? Big Bucket roared. How much food and fodder do you think Galbart Glover has laid by? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe ironborn were not a forgiving people, and Asha had been defeated twice.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOnce at the kingsmoot by her uncle Euron, and again at Deepwood Motte by Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWedding Justin Massey, or any of Stannis Baratheons lordlings, would hurt more than it helped.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Still, if Ser Justin wished to court her favor with food and wine and words, Asha was not like to discourage him.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAsha would have called them kings men, but the other stormlanders and crownlands men named them queens men though the queen they followed was the red one at Castle Black, not the wife that Stannis Baratheon had left behind at Eastwatch-by-the-Sea. <emphasis > Oh, Lord of Light, we beseech you, cast your fiery eye upon us and keep us safe and warm, < / emphasis > they sang to the flames
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe was also arrogant and vain, it seemed to Asha, hungry for glory, deaf to caution, a glutton for praise, and contemptuous of smallfolk, wolves, and women.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I am not Theon, Asha insisted but the chains remained.

2016-07-07 00:50fileLady Alannys sat beside a window, staring out across the sea. Did you bring my baby boy? shed asked, mouth trembling. Theon could not come, Asha had told her, looking down upon the ruin of the woman who had given her birth, a mother who had lost two of her sons.
