2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Once I am wed it will be high treason to desire me. Dany pulled the coverlet up over her breasts.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany loved the way his gold tooth gleamed when he grinned.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany threw a pillow at him. You will leave Hizdahr be! < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou would not make a liar of Daario Naharis? Dany was helpless to refuse. As you wish.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Westerosi. It would be nice to hear the Common Tongue from someone besides Ser Barristan.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany sat amongst the rumpled bedclothes with her arms about her knees, so forlorn that she did not hear when Missandei came creeping in with bread and milk and figs. Your Grace?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany took a fig.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > That night her cooks roasted her a kid with dates and carrots, but Dany could only eat a bite of it.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The pale pink light of dawn found her still out on her terrace, asleep upon the grass beneath a blanket of fine dew. I promised Daario that I would hold court today, Daenerys told her handmaids when they woke her. Help me find my crown.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She made her descent an hour later. <emphasis > All kneel for Daenerys Stormborn, the Unburnt, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men, < / emphasis > Khaleesi < emphasis > of Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Shackles and Mother of Dragons, < / emphasis > Missandei called.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany sighed. Summon the first petitioner. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Would that I had the time, said Dany sweetly. I am to be wed upon the morrow. Her last meeting with the Green Grace had not gone well. What would you have of me? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany felt a blaze of anger.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The treachery of Brown Ben Plumm has shocked us all, she said, but your warning comes too late.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Another slap, < / emphasis > thought Dany, color rising to her face.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > It was close to sunset before Daario Naharis appeared with his new Stormcrows, the Westerosi who had come over to him from the Wind-blown.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany found herself glancing at them as yet another petitioner droned on and on.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When Daario brought them forward, she saw that one of them was a woman, big and blond and all in mail. Pretty Meris, her captain named her, though < emphasis > pretty < / emphasis > was the last thing Dany would have called her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany had no inkling why anyone would call him Frog.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany giggled. I think that I can guess, ser.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany glanced at Daario and saw anger flash across his face.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If need be, said Gerrold, though I will not claim that any of us is the equal of Barristan the Bold.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I knew someone else who did that once, said Dany, a man called Arstan Whitebeard.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Now, Dany said, your names. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If you wish, Daenerys said, curious, but as Frog started forward Daario Naharis stepped in front of him and held out a gloved hand. Give this gift to me. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bring it to the queen, Ser Barristan commanded. Now. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany could feel the anger in the hall. I am only a young girl, and young girls must have their gifts, she said lightly. Daario, please, you must not tease me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > May we know what it says, Your Grace? asked Ser Barristan. It is a secret pact, Dany said, made in Braavos when I was just a little girl.

2016-07-07 00:50filePrince Oberyn Martell signed for Dorne, with the Sealord of Braavos as witness. She handed the parchment to Ser Barristan, so he might read it for himself. The alliance is to be sealed by a marriage, it says.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIn return for Dornes help overthrowing the Usurper, my brother Viserys is to take Prince Dorans daughter Arianne for his queen. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The old knight read the pact slowly. If Robert had known of this, he would have smashed Sunspear as he once smashed Pyke, and claimed the heads of Prince Doran and the Red Viper and like as not, the head of this Dornish princess too. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No doubt that was why Prince Doran chose to keep the pact a secret, suggested Daenerys. If my brother Viserys had known that he had a Dornish princess waiting for him, he would have crossed to Sunspear as soon as he was old enough to wed. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And thereby brought Roberts warhammer down upon himself, and Dorne as well, said Frog. My father was content to wait for the day that Prince Viserys found his army. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Prince Doran. He sank back onto one knee. Your Grace, I have the honor to be Quentyn Martell, a prince of Dorne and your most leal subject. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dany laughed.

2016-07-07 00:50fileIn the Seven Kingdoms there are childrens tales of frogs who turn into enchanted princes when kissed by their true love. Smiling at the Dornish knights, she switched back to the Common Tongue. Tell me, Prince Quentyn, are you enchanted? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileInstead of Viserys and your sister, you and I must seal this pact if I want Dorne. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Daario Naharis gave a scornful laugh. I say you are a pup.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Prince Quentyn answered him. Dorne is fifty thousand spears and swords, pledged to our queens service. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Enough, < / emphasis > Daenerys said. Prince Quentyn has crossed half the world to offer me his gift, I will not have him treated with discourtesy. She turned to the Dornishmen. Would that you had come a year ago.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I will be the judge of that, Daenerys said. Reznak, see that the prince and his companions are given quarters suitable to their high birth, and that their wants are attended to. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Daario and Ser Barristan followed her up the steps to her apartments. This changes everything, the old knight said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > This changes nothing, Dany said, as Irri removed her crown. What good are three men? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany unrolled the parchment and examined it again.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Could Hizdahr zo Loraq be working for the warlocks, was that what the dream had meant?
2016-07-07 00:50fileSomething tickled at her memory. Ser Barristan, what are the arms of House Martell? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > But when the sun rose upon her wedding day so did Daario Naharis, donning his clothes and buckling on his sword belt with its gleaming golden wantons. Where are you going? Dany asked him. I forbid you to make a sortie today. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileI will bring you back the head of Brown Ben Plumm for a wedding gift. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No heads, Dany insisted. Once you brought me flowers. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Come back to bed and kiss me. No one had ever kissed her like Daario Naharis. I am your queen, and I command you to fuck me. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > He is going to make a sortie, < / emphasis > Dany realized, < emphasis > and if he takes Ben Plumms head, hell walk into the wedding feast and throw it at my feet.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When he was gone, Missandei brought the queen a simple meal of goat cheese and olives, with raisins for a sweet. Your Grace needs more than wine to break her fast.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > That made Daenerys laugh, coming from a girl so small.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe relied so much on the little scribe that she oft forgot that Missandei had only turned eleven.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAs Dany nibbled on an olive, the Naathi girl gazed at her with eyes like molten gold and said, It is not too late to tell them that you have decided not to wed. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > A queen loves where she must, not where she will. Her appetite had left her. Take this food away, she told Missandei. It is time I bathed. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Afterward, as Jhiqui was patting Daenerys dry, Irri approached with her < emphasis > tokar.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany envied the Dothraki maids their loose sandsilk trousers and painted vests.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe remembered the night of her first wedding, when Khal Drogo had claimed her maidenhead beneath the stranger stars.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Missandei reemerged from inside the pyramid. Reznak and Skahaz beg the honor of escorting Your Grace to the Temple of the Graces.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThey preferred palanquins, litters, and sedan chairs, borne upon the shoulders of their slaves. Horses befoul the streets, one man of Zakh had told her, slaves do not. Dany had freed the slaves, yet palanquins, litters, and sedan chairs still choked the streets as before, and none of them floated magically through the air.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The day is too hot to be shut up in a palanquin, said Dany. Have my silver saddled.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace, said Missandei, this one is so sorry, but you cannot ride in a < emphasis > tokar.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany made a face. As you say.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When Dany made her descent, Reznak and Skahaz dropped to their knees. Your Worship shines so brightly, you will blind every man who dares to look upon you, said Reznak.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany had acquired three of those huge, queer beasts with her pyramid.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She found Strong Belwas eating grapes, as Barristan Selmy watched a stableboy cinch the girth on his dapple grey.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If you would please me, ser, be happy for me, Daenerys said. This is my wedding day.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWesteros may be swallowed by the waves. Dany kissed his cheek. Come.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Barristan helped her up onto her sedan chair.
2016-07-07 00:50fileQuentyn rejoined his fellow Dornishmen.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStrong Belwas bellowed for the gates to be opened, and Daenerys Targaryen was carried forth into the sun.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tell me, Dany said, as the procession turned toward the Temple of the Graces, if my father and my mother had been free to follow their own hearts, whom would they have wed? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > And Daario Naharis is only a sellsword, not fit to buckle on the golden spurs of even a landed knight.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Barristan shifted in the saddle. Not not loved.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As you command. The white knight chose his words with care. Prince Aerys as a youth, he was taken with a certain lady of Casterly Rock, a cousin of Tywin Lannister.

2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen she and Tywin wed, your father drank too much wine at the wedding feast and was heard to say that it was a great pity that the lords right to the first night had been abolished.

2016-07-07 00:50fileA drunken jape, no more, but Tywin Lannister was not a man to forget such words, or the the liberties your father took during the bedding. His face reddened. I have said too much, Your Grace.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Gracious queen, well met! < / emphasis > Another procession had come up beside her own, and Hizdahr zo Loraq was smiling at her from his own sedan chair.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany wondered where Daario Naharis was, what he was doing.

2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > If he loved you, he would come and carry you off at swordpoint, as Rhaegar carried off his northern girl, < / emphasis > the girl in her insisted, but the queen knew that was folly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany looked for Ezzara and did not see her.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHolding her < emphasis > tokar < / emphasis > daintily so as not to tread upon its fringes, Daenerys Targaryen eased herself onto the chairs plush velvet seat, and Hizdahr zo Loraq went to his knees, unlaced her sandals, and washed her feet whilst fifty eunuchs sang and ten thousand eyes looked on.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Queen Selyse descended upon Castle Black with her daughter and her daughters fool, her serving girls and lady companions, and a retinue of knights, sworn swords, and men-at-arms fifty strong.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Queens men all, < / emphasis > Jon Snow knew.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > They may attend Selyse, but it is Melisandre they serve.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He met the queens party by the stables, accompanied by Satin, Bowen Marsh, and half a dozen guards in long black cloaks.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere was even a hint of warmth in the air as Jon Snow took a knee before this southron queen. Your Grace.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Queen Selyse looked down at him. My thanks.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe wore a crown of red gold with points in the shape of flames, a twin to that worn by Stannis. you may rise, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Princess. Jon inclined his head.

2016-07-07 00:50fileShireen was a homely child, made even uglier by the greyscale that had left her neck and part of her cheek stiff and grey and cracked. My brothers and I are at your service, he told the girl.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Shireen reddened. Thank you, my lord. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > My loyal knights, Queen Selyse went on. Ser Narbert, Ser Benethon, Ser Brus, Ser Patrek, Ser Dorden, Ser Malegorn, Ser Lambert, Ser Perkin. Each worthy bowed in turn.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Then the queen beckoned to another curious member of her entourage: a tall gaunt stick of a man, his height accentuated by an outlandish three-tiered hat of purple felt. And here we have the honorable Tycho Nestoris, an emissary of the Iron Bank of Braavos, come to treat with His Grace King Stannis. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileHalf a foot taller than Jon, the Braavosi sported a beard as thin as a rope sprouting from his chin and reaching almost to his waist.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow had thought of little since.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon turned back to the queen. The royal chambers in the Kings Tower have been prepared for Your Grace for so long as you wish to remain with us.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThis is our Lord Steward, Bowen Marsh.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > As you say, Your Grace, said Jon. You will be cold and hungry, I am sure.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThis way, if you will? Queen Selyse nodded, took her daughter by the hand, and permitted him to lead them from the stables.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace, said Jon Snow, my builders have done all they can to make the Nightfort ready to receive you yet much of it remains in ruins.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Queen Selyse sniffed. We are done with Eastwatch.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShireen will one day sit the Iron Throne and rule the Seven Kingdoms.
2016-07-07 00:50filePrincess Shireen gave a shriek, and three of the queens knights gasped in harmony.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dont be afraid, Jon told them. Theres no harm in him, Your Grace.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He only knows a few words of the Common Tongue as yet, said Jon. In their own land, giants speak the Old Tongue. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileA filthy creature. The queen turned her frown on Jon. Lord Snow, what is this bestial creature doing on our side of the Wall? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Almost all. < emphasis > Ygritte wept for them.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe queen grabbed hold of Princess Shireen and pulled her back, her knights reached for their swords, and Patchface reeled away in alarm, lost his footing, and plopped down on his arse in a snowdrift.
2016-07-07 00:50filePatchface covered his ears, Princess Shireen pressed her face into her mothers furs, and the boldest of the queens knights moved forward, steel in hand.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon raised an arm to block his path. You do < emphasis > not < / emphasis > want to anger him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Eat now, Wun Wun? asked the giant. Eat now, Jon agreed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon had enough to contend with just now without adding a drunken giant to the mix.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Lord Tycho, Jon called. A moment, please. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis fire had gone out some time ago; Satin was not as diligent in feeding it as Dolorous Edd had been.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon hung up his cloak. You come seeking Stannis, is that correct? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileQueen Selyse has suggested that we might send word to Deepwood Motte by raven, to inform His Grace that I await his pleasure at the Nightfort.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAs to King Robert it was indeed our pleasure to assist His Grace in his need.
2016-07-07 00:50fileFor so long as Robert lived, all was well.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > You cannot mean to hold Stannis responsible for his brothers debts. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The debts belong to the Iron Throne, Tycho declared, and whoso-ever sits on that chair must pay them.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSince young King Tommen and his counsellors have become so obdurate, we mean to broach the subject with King Stannis.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Much of this Jon had surmised the moment he learned that the Iron Bank had sent an envoy to the Wall. When last we heard, His Grace was marching on Winterfell to confront Lord Bolton and his allies.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tycho bowed his head. We who serve the Iron Bank face death full as often as you who serve the Iron Throne. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon Snow was no longer certain. I can provide you with horses, provisions, guides, whatever is required to get you as far as Deepwood Motte.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Spring? Tycho sighed. It is not possible, my lord. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > What was it Stannis had said to him?
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > You haggle like a crone with a codfish, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDid Lord Eddard father you on a fishwife?
2016-07-07 00:50fileBy the time Jon Snow signed the parchment the Braavosi drew up, both of them were half-drunk and quite unhappy.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon thought that a good sign.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The day had darkened by the time he and Tycho Nestoris left the solar.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSnow had begun to fall. Our respite was a brief one, it would seem. Jon drew his cloak about himself more tightly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Three of my men passed through Braavos not long ago, Jon told him. An old maester, a singer, and a young steward.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I will take you there myself. Jon gestured. This way. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Once there, it would have been discourteous not to break bread with the banker, so Jon sent Satin off to fetch them food.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen he espied Jon Snow, Axell Florent tossed a bone aside, wiped his mouth with the back of his hand, and sauntered over.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWith his bowed legs, barrel chest, and prominent ears, he presented a comical appearance, but Jon knew better than to laugh at him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe was an uncle to Queen Selyse and had been among the first to follow her in accepting Melisandres red god.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Axell Florents brother had been burned by Melisandre, Maester Aemon had informed him, yet Ser Axell had done little and less to stop it.

2016-07-07 00:50fileMight I join you? He lowered himself to the bench before they could reply. Lord Snow, if I may ask this wildling princess His Grace King Stannis wrote of where might she be, my lord? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Long leagues from here, < / emphasis > Jon thought.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > If the gods are good, by now she has found Tormund Giantsbane.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Val is the younger sister of Dalla, who was Mance Rayders wife and mother to his son.
2016-07-07 00:50fileKing Stannis took Val and the child captive after Dalla died in childbed, but she is no princess, not as you mean it. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon wondered.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Forgive me, ser, but Val will not be joining us. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The queen would never presume upon our hospitality, Jon said, hoping that was true. Now I fear I must take my leave, before I forget the duties of a host.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Tycho, pray excuse me. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Back in his solar, Jon found the Old Bears raven perched on the back of the oak-and-leather chair behind the trestle table.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon took a fistful of dried kernels from the sack by the door and scattered them on the floor, then claimed the chair.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tycho Nestoris had left behind a copy of their agreement.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon read it over thrice.

2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > A long hard winter will leave the Watch so deep in debt that we will never climb out, < / emphasis > Jon reminded himself, < emphasis > but when the choice is debt or death, best borrow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTycho Nestoris had impressed him as cultured and courteous, but the Iron Bank of Braavos had a fearsome reputation when collecting debts.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > As poor plump Tommen may be about to learn.

2016-07-07 00:50fileIf Stannis was not too stiff-necked to accept their terms, the Braavosi would give him all the gold and silver he required, coin enough to buy a dozen sellsword companies, to bribe a hundred lords, to keep his men paid, fed, clothed, and armed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Unless Stannis is lying dead beneath the walls of Winterfell, he may just have won the Iron Throne.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > He wondered if Melisandre had seen < emphasis > that < / emphasis > in her fires.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon sat back, yawned, stretched.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The Old Bear had led a ranging.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon closed his eyes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJust for a moment and woke, stiff as a board, with the Old Bears raven muttering, <emphasis > Snow, Snow, < / emphasis > and Mully shaking him. Mlord, youre wanted.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A girl? Jon sat, rubbing the sleep from his eyes with the back of his hands. Val?
2016-07-07 00:50fileHas Val returned? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Not Val, mlord.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Arya.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jon straightened.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut what had become of Mance Rayder and his spearwives? Where is the girl now? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Thats good. Jon felt fifteen years old again.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDid you have some other task for Mance?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He wanted to believe it would be Arya.
2016-07-07 00:50fileNor was he about to turn her over to Stannis or Melisandre.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > She could return to Braavos with Tycho Nestoris.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Wherever he might send her, though, Arya would need silver to support her, a roof above her head, someone to protect her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon stepped over a puddle of damp clothing. <emphasis > Snow, Snow, Snow, < / emphasis > the ravens called down from above.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > She looked enough like Arya to give him pause, but only for a moment.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Has she eaten? Jon asked Mully.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Only bread and broth, my lord. Clydas rose from a chair. It is best to go slow, Maester Aemon always said.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon could not blame her for that.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > She does look a bit like Arya, < / emphasis > Jon thought.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > " Jon Snow. The girl tossed her braid back. My house and yours are bound in blood and honor.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon was staring.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You came to Winterfell with your father. < emphasis > The father Robb beheaded.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI was almost of an age with Robb, and my father thought we might make a match.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYour brother Robb cut off his head for killing Lannisters. Her mouth twisted. I thought the whole reason they marched south was to kill some Lannisters. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileIs there blood feud between us, Lord Snow? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileI did not know where else to turn but to the last son of Eddard Stark. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > My < emphasis > uncle < / emphasis > declared for Stannis, in hopes it might provoke the Lannisters to take poor Harrys head.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHes buried two wives already. She rubbed away a tear angrily, the way Arya might have done it. Will you help me? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileI will write to Stannis on your behalf, but" < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis will be dead before he gets your message.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe cast his lot with Roose Bolton long ago for gold, the promise of a pardon, and poor Harrys head.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Stannis is marching to a slaughter.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSo he cannot help me, and would not even if he could. Alys knelt before him, clutching the black cloak. You are my only hope, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Ser Gregor, < / emphasis > she thought.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSer Ilyn, Ser Meryn, Queen Cersei.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Beth. She had known a Beth once, back at Winterfell when she was Arya Stark.

2016-07-07 00:50fileOnce she almost fell head-long down the steps, but Syrio Forel had taught her balance in another lifetime, when she was the girl called Arya, and somehow she recovered and caught herself in time.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Some nights she might have cried herself to sleep if she had still been Arry or Weasel or Cat, or even Arya of House Stark but no one had no tears.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe waif had shaved her head for her when they took her eyes; a mummers cut, she called it, since many mummers did the same so their wigs might fit them better.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Good. She had never cared if she was pretty, even when she was stupid Arya Stark.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Him, and Jon < / emphasis > < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileIf the gods were good, he might stumble on the Blackfish, or lure Beric Dondarrion into an unwise attack.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJaime called his hostage forward and asked him where to find the nearest ford, and the boy led them there.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAs the column splashed across the shallow waters, the sun was setting behind a pair of grassy hills. The Teats, said Hoster Blackwood.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jaime recalled Lord Brackens map. Theres a village between those hills. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I can see what they resemble. Jaime found himself thinking back on the woman in the tent and the way shed tried to hide her large, dark nipples. What changed a hundred years ago? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > named them for his mistress. Aegon the Fourth had died long before Jaime had been born, but he recalled enough of the history of his reign to guess what must have happened next. Only later he put the Bracken girl aside and took up with a Blackwood, was that the way of it? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lady Melissa, Hoster confirmed. Missy, they called her.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > gave her Barbas teats. Jaime laughed. How did all this begin, between Blackwood and Bracken?

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Not all, said Jaime. Lord Eddards daughters live.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe other < emphasis > Brienne, where are you?
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Jaime let Honor feel his spurs.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThrough the gathering blue dusk Jaime glimpsed fresh thatch upon a score of roofs, and doors made of raw green wood.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Hiding, Jaime told him.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe nanny goat that Hot Harry Merrell found rooting through a vegetable garden was the only living creature to be seen but the village had a holdfast as strong as any in the riverlands, with thick stone walls twelve feet high, and Jaime knew that was where hed find the villagers.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Not my men, Jaime said. Will you open your gates? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > While they drop stones on us and feather us with arrows. Jaime shook his head. It would be a bloody business, and for what?

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jaime scrambled to his feet. My lady.

2016-07-07 00:50fileElsewise, the Hound will kill her. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Rhllor, sang Melisandre, her arms upraised against the falling snow, you are the light in our eyes, the fire in our hearts, the heat in our loins.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow raised the hood of his cloak.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Alys Karstark leaned close to Jon. Snow during a wedding means a cold marriage.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He glanced at Queen Selyse.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > There must have been a blizzard the day she and Stannis wed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > A word from Melisandre, and she would walk into the fire willingly, embrace it like a lover.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow had begun to understand why Stannis had left them with his queen.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The night is dark and filled with terrors, Melisandre sang. Alone we are born and alone we die, but as we walk through this black vale we draw strength from one another, and from you, our lord. Her scarlet silks and satins swirled with every gust of wind. Two come forth today to join their lives, so they may face this worlds darkness together.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Lord of Light, protect us, < / emphasis > cried Queen Selyse.
2016-07-07 00:50filePrincess Shireen was wrapped in so many furs that she looked round, breathing in white puffs through the scarf that covered most of her face.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon took careful note of who was there and who was not.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOthell Yarwyck and Bowen Marsh were amongst the missing.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Melisandre raised her hands, and the ditchfire leapt upward toward her fingers, like a great red dog springing for a treat.
2016-07-07 00:50fileA swirl of sparks rose to meet the snowflakes coming down. Oh, Lord of Light, we thank you, she sang to the hungry flames. We thank you for brave Stannis, by your grace our king.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Grant him strength, < / emphasis > answered Queen Selyse and her knights and ladies.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Alys Karstark slipped her arm through Jons. How much longer, Lord Snow?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Soon, my lady, Jon assured her. Soon. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And Melisandre said, Let them come forth, who would be joined. The flames cast her shadow on the Wall behind her, and her ruby gleamed against the paleness of her throat.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon turned to Alys Karstark. My lady.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The girl smiled in a way that reminded Jon so much of his little sister that it almost broke his heart. Let him be scared of me. The snowflakes were melting on her cheeks, but her hair was wrapped in a swirl of lace that Satin had found somewhere, and the snow had begun to collect there, giving her a frosty crown.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Winters lady. Jon squeezed her hand.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis receding hair made him look older than his years, but as he turned to watch his bride approach, Jon could see the boy in him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHis eyes were big as walnuts, though whether it was the fire, the priestess, or the woman that had put the fear in him Jon could not say.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Who brings this woman to be wed? asked Melisandre. I do, said Jon. Now comes Alys of House Karstark, a woman grown and flowered, of noble blood and birth. He gave her hand one last squeeze and stepped back to join the others.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Who comes forth to claim this woman? asked Melisandre. Me. Sigorn slapped his chest. Magnar of Thenn. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Sigorn, asked Melisandre, will you share your fire with Alys, and warm her when the night is dark and full of terrors? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileSnow dappled his shoulders.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Except for kings and uncles, < / emphasis > thought Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow met them on the kingsroad half a league south of Moles Town, before they could turn up at Castle Black, claim guest right, or call for parley.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Thenns had no family arms as was customary amongst the nobles of the Seven Kingdoms, so Jon told the stewards to improvise.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe queens men began to sing a song of praise. Is it done? Jon heard Satin whisper.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe crowd began to break apart and stream from the yard, queens men, kings men, and free folk alike, all anxious to get out of the wind and the cold. Will my lord be feasting with us? Mully asked Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon crossed to Queen Selyse, with Ghost beside him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileOh, you cannot know how many times I have begged Stannis to let us be wed again, a true joining of body and spirit blessed by the Lord of Light.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Even at the Wall, it was common knowledge that Stannis Baratheon had shunned his wife for years.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon bowed. If it please Your Grace, the feast awaits. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The queen glanced at Ghost suspiciously, then raised her head to Jon. To be sure.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLady Melisandre knows the way. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Oh. Queen Selyse looked stricken. To be sure let us pray for a vision from our lord < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Satin, show Her Grace to her place, said Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWe shall not require your steward. The way the man drew out the last word told Jon that he had been considering saying something else.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon bowed again. As you wish.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Malegorn offered his arm, and Queen Selyse took it stiffly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > All it would take was a word in the queens ear, and Patchface would feed her fires. You see fools in your fire, but no hint of Stannis? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Clydas had dispatched a raven to Deepwood Motte to warn the king of Arnolf Karstarks treachery, but whether the bird had reached His Grace in time Jon did not know.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Braavosi banker was off in search of Stannis as well, accompanied by the guides that Jon had given him, but between the war and weather, it would be a wonder if he found him. Would you know if the king was dead? Jon asked the red priestess.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis is the Lords chosen, destined to lead the fight against the dark.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe was born at Storms End, like his brothers. He frowned. And what of Mance?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > It was snowing heavily to the south, Jon knew.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Melisandre knows that too.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI am as mortal as you, Jon Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Even lord commanders. Mance Rayder and his spearwives had not returned, and Jon could not help but wonder whether the red woman had lied of a purpose.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon scratched him behind the ears. But now you must excuse me.

2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow could see his own reflection dimly inside the icy walls.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > In one corner of the cell a heap of furs was piled up almost to the height of a man. Karstark, said Jon Snow. Wake up. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou are a prisoner. Jon let that hang for a moment, then said, Your niece is wed. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileTo balance the three Yunkish nobles and four sellsword captains, Meereen sent seven of its own out to the siege camp: Hizdahrs sister, two of his cousins, Danys bloodrider Jhogo, her admiral Groleo, the Unsullied captain Hero, and Daario Naharis.

2016-07-07 00:50fileWhen Prince Quentyn told them that the other Westerosi had come over to the Stormcrows at the command of the Tattered Prince, only the intercession of Grey Worm and his Unsullied prevented Daario from killing them all.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Dany could not risk his cutting down Brown Ben Plumm, making mock of Hizdahr before the court, provoking the Yunkaii, or otherwise upsetting the agreement that she had given up so much to win.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIn return the Yunkaii had promised to respect the rights and liberties of the former slaves that Dany had freed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > He will give us these castrati, < / emphasis > Dany thought, < emphasis > and then he will march home and make some more.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWine cups in hand, the Yunkaii wandered the garden in small groups, beneath lemon trees and night-blooming flowers, and Dany found herself face-to-face with Brown Ben Plumm.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Now thats a harsh way o putting it, if you dont mind me saying. Brown Ben scratched at his speckled grey-and-white whiskers. We went over to the winning side, is all.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Never that, said Brown Ben, but its not all about the coin, Your High-and-Mightiness.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > You saw me as defeated, < / emphasis > Dany thought, < emphasis > and who am I to say that you were wrong?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Brown Ben laughed. Fool boy that I was, I told a man I took to be my friend, and he told our serjeant, and my brothers-in-arms come and relieved me o that burden.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Barristan? she said softly.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Or a queen, < / emphasis > thought Dany. Is there some man in the Second Sons who might be persuaded to remove Brown Ben? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Our prisoners, suggested Dany. The Westerosi who came over from the Windblown with the three Dornishmen.

2016-07-07 00:50fileEven here in her own pyramid, on this happy night of peace and celebration, Ser Barristan insisted on keeping guards about her everywhere she went.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe small company made the long descent in silence, stopping thrice to refresh themselves along the way. The dragon has three heads, Dany said when they were on the final flight. My marriage need not be the end of all your hopes.

2016-07-07 00:50fileCome. She took Prince Quentyn by the hand and led him to the pit where two of her dragons were confined. Remain outside, Dany told Ser Barristan, as the Unsullied were opening the huge iron doors. Prince Quentyn will protect me. She drew the Dornish prince inside with her, to stand above the pit.
2016-07-07 00:50fileQuentyn Martell jumped back a foot.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A crueler woman might have laughed at him, but Dany squeezed his hand and said, They frighten me as well.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAll I know of dragons is what my brother told me when I was a girl, and some I read in books, but it is said that even Aegon the Conqueror never dared mount Vhagar or Meraxes, nor did his sisters ride Balerion the Black Dread.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDragons live longer than men, some for hundreds of years, so Balerion had other riders after Aegon died but no rider ever flew two dragons. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > They are < emphasis > dragons, < / emphasis > Quentyn. Dany stood on her toes and kissed him lightly, once on each cheek. And so am I. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Under that ruined keep, my lord, replied Big Walder. The one with the old gargoyles. The boys gloves were caked with his cousins blood. I told him not to go out alone, but he said he had to find a man who owed him silver. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileRowan walked Theon from the hall.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And Little Walder was a piglet.

2016-07-07 00:50fileRowan and her scheming sisters did not want to attract notice, but their sullen silence soon had the guards giving them queer looks. Wheres Maisie and Jez and tother girls? one asked Theon. The usual ones. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Dirtier than you know, when you share that bed with Ramsay, < / emphasis > Theon thought, remembering the wedding night and the things that he and Jeyne had been made to do. Lord Ramsays command. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Theon could feel an itching in his missing fingers.

2016-07-07 00:50fileJeyne had pulled the furs up over herself to hide.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > The thought that Ramsay might be coming made him want to scream. My lady. Theon could not bring himself to call her Arya and dare not call her Jeyne. No need to hide.

2016-07-07 00:50fileRobb and Bran and Rickon. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jeyne pulled her wolfskins up to her chin. No.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd Prince Quentyn has come with his Dornish Men.

2016-07-07 00:50fileShe was the first, Jorah was the second, Brown Ben Plumm the third.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe boar charged, Barsena spun aside, her blade flashed silver in the sun. She needs a spear, Ser Barristan said, as Barsena vaulted over the beasts second charge. That is no way to fight a boar. He sounded like someones fussy old grandsire, just as Daario was always saying.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Dizzy, Dany closed her eyes.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDany could feel the heat of him between her thighs.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He was not a tall man, Tormund Giantsbane, but the gods had given him a broad chest and massive belly.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMance Rayder had named him Tormund Horn-Blower for the power of his lungs, and was wont to say that Tormund could laugh the snow off mountaintops.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIn his wroth, his bellows reminded Jon of a mammoth trumpeting.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > That day Tormund bellowed often and loudly.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe called Jon Snow a craven, a liar, and a turncloak, cursed him for a black-hearted buggering kneeler, a robber, and a carrion crow, accused him of wanting to fuck the free folk up the arse.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTormund was not the sort of man to waste good mead.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon let it all wash over him.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Finally, as the shadows of the afternoon grew long outside the tent, Tormund Giantsbane" Tall-Talker, Horn-Blower, and Breaker of Ice, Tormund Thunderfist, Husband to Bears, Mead-King of Ruddy Hall, Speaker to Gods and Father of Hosts" thrust out his hand. Done then, and may the gods forgive me.

2016-07-07 00:50fileSome o my own will spit on me when they hear these terms. Tormund released Jons hand. Your crows will grumble too, if I know them.

2016-07-07 00:50fileTill then The wildling pulled off the band from his left arm and tossed it at Jon, then did the same with its twin upon his right. Your first payment.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTormund Giantsbane had worn them as long as Jon had known him; they had seemed as much a part of him as his beard. The Braavosi will melt these down for the gold.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIll not have it said that Tormund Thunderfist made the free folk give up their treasures whilst he kept his own. He grinned. But Ill keep the ring I wear about me member.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon had to laugh. You never change. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon put a hand on his shoulder. I am so sorry. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut not his. Tormund shook his head. I still have two strong sons. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileI told him if he ever hurt her, Id yank his member off and beat him bloody with it. He gave Jon another hearty slap. Time you were going back.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHar! Tormund led Jon from his tent.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThere was a saying Jon had heard from the older men at Castle Black: < emphasis > the Wall has more moods than Mad King Aerys, < / emphasis > theyd say, or sometimes, < emphasis > the Wall has more moods than a woman.

2016-07-07 00:50fileHe and Leathers were the only men Jon had brought with him to the parley; any more might have been seen as a sign of fear, and twenty men would have been of no more use than two if Tormund had been intent on blood.
2016-07-07 00:50fileGhost was the only protection Jon needed; the direwolf could sniff out foes, even those who hid their enmity behind smiles.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon peeled off one black glove, put two fingers in his mouth, and whistled. <emphasis > Ghost!
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Did you follow me as well? Jon reached to shoo the bird away but ended up stroking its feathers.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe raven cocked its eye at him. <emphasis > Snow, < / emphasis > it muttered, bobbing its head knowingly.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThen Ghost emerged from between two trees, with Val beside him.

2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Val was clad all in white; white woolen breeches tucked into high boots of bleached white leather, white bearskin cloak pinned at the shoulder with a carved weirwood face, white tunic with bone fastenings.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt had been a long while since Jon Snow had seen a sight so lovely.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Har! laughed Tormund Giantsbane. Dont bandy words with this one, Lord Snow, shes too clever for the likes o you and me.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > What had that oaf Axell Florent said of Val?

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Val patted the long bone knife on her hip. Lord Crow is welcome to steal into my bed any night he dares.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAsk them to join me atop the Wall at sunset. He turned to Val. My lady.

The crow, the crow, Patchface cried when he saw Jon. Under the sea the crows are white as snow, I know, I know, oh, oh, oh. Princess Shireen

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Queen Selyse set aside her sewing. You may rise. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If it please Your Grace, may I present the Lady Val?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Are you the wildling princess? Shireen asked Val. Some call me that, said Val. My sister was wife to Mance Rayder, the King-Beyond-the-Wall.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Im a princess too, Shireen announced, but I never had a sister.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Honestly, Shireen, her mother said. I am sure the lord commander did not come to hear about Roberts by-blows.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon said, Your Grace, the leader of the free folk has agreed to my terms. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Queen Selyse gave the tiniest of nods. It was ever my lord husbands wish to grant sanctuary to these savage peoples.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Val answered. Almost two hundred of them, Your Grace.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The queen shuddered. Dreadful creatures. Jon could not tell if she was speaking of the mammoths or the giants. Though such beasts might be useful to my lord husband in his battles. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > That may be, Your Grace, Jon said, but the mammoths are too big to pass through our gate. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Selyse sniffed. If you say so.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > The cold will have killed the spiders by now, < / emphasis > thought Jon, < emphasis > and the rats may be a useful source of meat come winter.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I see you have considered all this carefully, Lord Snow.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI am sure King Stannis will be pleased when he returns triumphant from his battle. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Of course, the queen went on, the wildlings must first acknowledge Stannis as their king and Rhllor as their god. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Free folk do not kneel, Val told her. Then they must be knelt, the queen declared. Do that, Your Grace, and we will rise again at the first chance, Val promised. Rise with blades in hand. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileWe must find you a husband who can teach you courtesy. The queen turned her glare on Jon. I do not approve, Lord Commander.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Your Grace. Jon knelt again.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThis time Val did not join him. I am sorry my actions have displeased you.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Once outside and well away from the queens men, Val gave vent to her wroth. You lied about her beard.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > This was a Val that Jon had never seen before. Princess Shireen is the queens only child. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If Stannis wins his war, Shireen will stand as heir to the Iron Throne. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou know nothing, Jon Snow. Val seized his arm. I want the monster out of there.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon shook her hand away.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYet death is there. She walked away from him, stopped, turned back. I brought you Tormund Giantsbane.
2016-07-07 00:50fileYou owe me a debt, Jon Snow. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon watched her stride away.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > The Wall is mine, < / emphasis > Jon reminded himself as the winchmen were swinging in the cage, < emphasis > for two more days, at least.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon hopped down onto the ice, thanked the men on the winch, and nodded to the spearmen standing sentry.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > A good lord must know his men, < / emphasis > his father had once told him and Robb, back at Winterfell.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon walked to the edge of the Wall and gazed down upon the killing ground where Mance Rayders host had died.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe wondered where Mance was now.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > It had been so long since he had last seen Arya.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Arya Underfoot.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWisdom for her wedding night if half of what he heard of Ramsay Snow was true.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Bring her home, Mance.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI saved your son from Melisandre, and now I am about to save four thousand of your free folk.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJon Snow flexed the fingers of his sword hand, remembering all hed lost.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Sam, you sweet fat fool, you played me a cruel jape when you made me lord commander.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Snow? said Leathers. The cage is coming up. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I hear it. Jon moved back from the edge.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBowen Marsh came next, bundled up in a bearskin.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Walk with me, Jon told them.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThree days hence at dawn the gate will open, to allow Tormund and his people through the Wall.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > " scrawny wildlings, bone weary, hungry, far from home. Jon pointed at the lights of their campfires. There they are.
2016-07-07 00:50fileFour thousand, Tormund claims. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Three thousand, I make them, by the fires. Bowen Marsh lived for counts and measures. More than twice that number at Hardhome with the woods witch, we are told.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon did not deny it. Tormund says the Weeper means to try the Bridge of Skulls again. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Not gladly. Jon had not forgotten the heads the Weeping Man had left him, with bloody holes where their eyes had been.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > When a man takes the black, his crimes are forgiven, Jon reminded them. If we want the free folk to fight beside us, we must pardon their past crimes as we would for our own. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Once past the Wall, the wildlings will have thrice our numbers, said Bowen Marsh. And that is only Tormunds band.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Snow, said The Norrey, where do you mean to put these wild-lings o yours?

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The wildlings will remain upon the Wall, Jon assured them. Most will be housed in one of our abandoned castles. The Watch now had garrisons at Icemark, Long Barrow, Sable Hall, Greyguard, and Deep Lake, all badly undermanned, but ten castles still stood empty and abandoned. Men with wives and children, all orphan girls and any orphan boys below the age of ten, old women, widowed
2016-07-07 00:50fileTormund will take Oakenshield as his seat, to keep him close at hand. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bowen Marsh sighed. If they do not slay us with their swords, they will do so with their mouths.
2016-07-07 00:50filePray, how does the lord commander propose to feed Tormund and his thousands? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon had anticipated that question. Through Eastwatch.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > With gold, from the Iron Bank of Braavos, < / emphasis > Jon might have replied.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > The arms most wildlings carry are little more than sticks, < / emphasis > thought Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Tormund Giantsbane will never willingly disarm his people, Jon said. He is not the Weeping Man, but he is no craven either.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The Norrey fingered his beard. You may put your wildlings in these ruined forts, Lord Snow, but how will you make them stay?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The gods of the North, since before this Wall was raised, said Jon. Those are the gods that Tormund swore by.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI know him, as I knew Mance Rayder.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > No, < / emphasis > thought Jon, < emphasis > I did not think you had.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The free folk have neither laws nor lords, Jon said, but they love their children.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > My blood price, he called it, said Jon Snow, but he will pay. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Ask Janos Slynt.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI may seem a green boy in your eyes, Lord Norrey, but I am still a son of Eddard Stark. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Snow, must I remind you?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I know what I swore. Jon said the words. <emphasis > I am the sword in the darkness.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHow does that part go? Jon waited for an answer.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Bowen Marsh opened his mouth.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Jon Snow turned away.
2016-07-07 00:50fileDown below, Lady Melisandre would be lighting her nightfire and chanting, < emphasis > Lord of Light, defend us, for the night is dark and full of terrors.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Winter is coming, Jon said at last, breaking the awkward silence, and with it the white walkers.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTormund and his people will need to be fed and clothed and housed.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Clydas blinked his dim pink eyes. I will do my best, Jon.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Bowen, you shall collect the tolls.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Yes, Lord Snow, said Bowen Marsh.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > And Jon thought, <emphasis > Ice, < / emphasis > < emphasis > she said, < / emphasis > <emphasis > and daggers in the dark.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > CERSEI < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileCersei had torn up the first shift they gave her, demanding the return of her own clothes, but that only left her naked and shivering.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJaime would be coming for her, but how would she know when he arrived?
2016-07-07 00:50fileCersei only hoped he was not so foolish as to go racing ahead of his army.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe asked about Ser Loras too.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAt last report the Knight of Flowers had been dying on Dragonstone of wounds received whilst taking the castle.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Let him die, < / emphasis > Cersei thought, < emphasis > and let him be quick about it.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBut the septas were as close-mouthed about Loras Tyrell as they were about Jaime.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Qyburn had been her last and only visitor.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSepta Unella was big-boned and mannish, with callused hands and homely, scowling features.
2016-07-07 00:50fileHarys Swyft and Grand Maester Pycelle had abandoned her to captivity and offered the realm to the very men who had conspired against her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileEven her cousin Lancel, who once had claimed to love her, was one of her accusers.
2016-07-07 00:50fileJaime would be here once he knew of her plight. <emphasis > Come at once, < / emphasis > she had written to him.
2016-07-07 00:50fileCome at once. < / emphasis > Qyburn had sworn that he would see that her letter reached her twin, off in the riverlands with his army.
2016-07-07 00:50fileQyburn had never returned, however.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAll she knew for certain was that Jaime had not come.
2016-07-07 00:50fileShe had prayed for relief, for deliverance, for Jaime.

2016-07-07 00:50fileAll the prayers they had taught her as a girl came back to Cersei in her cell, and she made up new ones as needed, calling on the Mother and the Maiden, on the Father and the Warrior, on the Crone and the Smith.
2016-07-07 00:50fileCersei gave them all the words that she had in her, gave them everything but tears.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > If the gods had given her the strength they gave Jaime and that swaggering oaf Robert, she could have made her own escape.

2016-07-07 00:50fileShe stood accused of adultery, fornication, high treason, even murder, for Osney Kettleblack had confessed to smothering the last High Septon at her command. I am come to hear you tell of all your murders and fornications, Septa Unella would growl when she shook the queen awake.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Cersei could not allow that to happen.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Exhausted by her lack of sleep, shivering from the cold that stole into the tower cell each night, feverish and famished by turns, Cersei came at last to know she must confess.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > That night, when Septa Unella came to wrench her out of sleep, she found the queen waiting on her knees. I have sinned, said Cersei.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > I will tell him, Your Grace, said Septa Unella. His High Holiness will be most pleased.

2016-07-07 00:50fileThe owl and the wolf and the nightingale slipped by for once with their passage unseen and unremarked, whilst Cersei dreamed a long sweet dream where Jaime was her husband and their son was still alive.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > His High Holiness awaits, said Septa Unella.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Cersei lowered her head, humble and obedient. Might I be allowed to bathe first?

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You may wash later if His High Holiness allows, said Septa Unella. It is the cleanliness of your immortal soul that should concern you now, not such vanities of the flesh. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The three septas led her down the tower stairs, with Septa Unella going before her and Septa Moelle and Septa Scolera at her heels, as if they were afraid that she might try to flee. It has been so long since I have had a visitor, Cersei murmured in a quiet voice as they made their descent. Is the king well?
2016-07-07 00:50fileTommen loves her so.

2016-07-07 00:50fileI never believed those terrible things that were being said of her. Had Margaery Tyrell somehow wriggled free of the accusations of fornication, adultery, and high treason? Was there a trial? < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Soon, said Septa Scolera, but her brother" < emphasis > Hush. < / emphasis > Septa Unella turned to glare back over her shoulder at Scolera. You chatter too much, you foolish old woman.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The High Sparrow received her in his sanctum, an austere seven-sided chamber where crudely carved faces of the Seven stared out from the stone walls with expressions almost as sour and disapproving as His High Holiness himself.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Cersei dropped to her knees. I do, High Holiness.
2016-07-07 00:50fileUnella, you will stay and make a record of Her Graces words.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Septa Unella took a seat behind her, spread out a parchment, dipped a quill in maesters ink.
2016-07-07 00:50fileCersei felt a stab of fright. Once I have confessed, will I be permitted to" < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Cersei could hear Unella writing behind her.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe gods took King Robert from me, my love and my protector.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTommen needed men around him I could trust. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The Kingsguard stood by useless as his brother Joffrey died, murdered at his own wedding feast.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI have sinned, I have committed wanton fornication, but I did it for Tommen.
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhat of Ser Lancel, who was your cousin and your lord husbands squire?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lancel. Cersei hesitated.
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Careful, < / emphasis > she told herself, < emphasis > Lancel will have told him everything.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI took comfort with Lancel.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > The High Sparrow was not done with her, however. These are common sins, he said. The wickedness of widows is well-known, and all women are wantons at heart, given to using their wiles and their beauty to work their wills on men.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThere is no treason here, so long as you did not stray from your marriage bed whilst His Grace King Robert was still alive. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe further insists that he bore false witness against Queen Margaery and her cousins, telling tales of fornications, adultery, and high treason, again at your behest. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > No, said Cersei. It is not true.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI love Margaery as I would a daughter.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > In time, said the High Septon. You also stand accused of conspiring at the murder of your own lord husband, our late beloved King Robert, First of His Name. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Lancel, < / emphasis > Cersei thought. Robert was killed by a boar.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAm I accused of killing Joffrey too, my own sweet son, my firstborn? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He nodded. Last of all, and worst of all, there are some who say your children were not fathered by King Robert, that they are bastards born of incest and adultery. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Stannis says that, Cersei said at once. A lie, a lie, a palpable lie.
2016-07-07 00:50fileStannis wants the Iron Throne for himself, but his brothers children stand in his way, so he must needs claim that they are not his brothers.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Stannis has turned from the truth of the Seven to worship a red demon, and his false faith has no place in these Seven Kingdoms. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileCersei nodded. Even so, His High Holiness went on, these are terrible charges, and the realm must know the truth of them.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Cersei rose slowly from her knees. I bow to the wisdom of Your High Holiness, she said, but if I might beg for just one drop of the Mothers mercy, I it has been so long since I last saw my son, please < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50fileUnella followed close behind them. We have all been praying for Your Grace, Septa Moelle said as they were climbing. Yes, Septa Scolera echoed, and you must feel so much lighter now, clean and innocent as a maid on the morning of her wedding. < / p >

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > I fucked Jaime on the morning of my wedding, < / emphasis > the queen recalled. I do, she said, I feel reborn, as if a festering boil has been lanced and now at last I can begin to heal.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIf the gods were good, the wrinkled old cunt might crash into Septa Unella and take her down with her.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He did, said Septa Unella. If Your Grace will tell us whom you wish to see, we will send word to them. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Jaime, I need Jaime.

2016-07-07 00:50fileIt might be wiser to wait on Jaime until she had a better notion of what was happening beyond the walls of the Great Sept of Baelor. My uncle, she said. Ser Kevan Lannister, my fathers brother.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > He is, said Septa Unella. The Lord Regent has taken up residence in the Red Keep.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Thank you, said Cersei, thinking, < emphasis > Lord Regent, is it?
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Cersei was still at her breakfast when the door swung open and Ser Kevan Lannister stepped through. Leave us, he told her gaolers.
2016-07-07 00:50fileSepta Unella ushered Scolera and Moelle away and closed the door behind them.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Kevan looked older than when shed seen him last.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLancel is my < emphasis > son, < / emphasis > Cersei.
2016-07-07 00:50fileI know. < emphasis > Lancel wanted me more than I ever wanted him.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Kevan suffered the embrace for a few heartbeats before he finally raised his own arms to return it.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > His words frightened her. Has something happened to Tommen?
2016-07-07 00:50filePlease tell me that Tommen is well. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe asks about you often. Ser Kevan laid his hands on her shoulders, held her at arms length.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIs it Jaime? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileJaime is still in the riverlands, somewhere. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > A woman? Cersei stared at him, uncomprehending. What woman?
2016-07-07 00:50file< emphasis > Jaime would never abandon me for such a creature.

2016-07-07 00:50file< p > We have had reports of sellswords landing all over the south, Ser Kevan was saying. Tarth, the Stepstones, Cape Wrath where Stannis found the coin to hire a free company I would dearly love to know.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMace Tyrell does, but he refuses to bestir himself until this matter with his daughter has been settled. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > A headsman would settle Margaery quick enough.
2016-07-07 00:50file< / emphasis > Cersei did not care a fig for Stannis or his sellswords.
2016-07-07 00:50fileBy force of arms? Ser Kevan walked to the window and gazed out, frowning. I would need to make an abbatoir of this holy place.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Kevan was unmoved. If that is your wish, you may soon have it granted.
2016-07-07 00:50fileMace Tyrell has been named Kings Hand.
2016-07-07 00:50fileGrand Maester Pycelle and Ser Harys Swyft will continue as before, but Paxter Redwyne is now lord admiral and Randyll Tarly has assumed the duties of justiciar. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > < emphasis > Qyburn, < / emphasis > thought Cersei.
2016-07-07 00:50fileLord Qyburn had them, and Lord Qyburn could do wonders.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Sit down? Cersei shook her head.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > <emphasis > Tyrion, < / emphasis > she said at once.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion had sent her little girl to Dorne, and Cersei had dispatched Ser Balon Swann to bring her home.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Ser Kevan gave her another scowl. Myrcella was attacked by a Dornish knight named Gerold Dayne.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > An ear. Cersei stared at him, aghast.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd Prince Doran and his Dornish knights, where were they?
2016-07-07 00:50fileWhere was Arys Oakheart? < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Prince Doran says nothing of your brother.
2016-07-07 00:50fileAnd Balon Swann writes that Myrcella puts it all on this Gerold Dayne.
2016-07-07 00:50fileTyrion has friends amongst the Dornish.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThe Imp planned this all along.
2016-07-07 00:50fileIt was Tyrion who betrothed Myrcella to Prince Trystane.
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > You see Tyrion in every shadow. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileHe killed Joffrey.

2016-07-07 00:50fileI feared that the Imp was still in Kings Landing plotting harm to Tommen, but he must have gone to Dorne instead to kill Myrcella first. Cersei paced the width of the cell. I need to be with Tommen.
2016-07-07 00:50fileThese Kingsguard knights are as useless as nipples on a breastplate. She rounded on her uncle. Ser Arys was killed, you said. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50fileTommen must be protected. < / p >
2016-07-07 00:50file< p > Lord Tarly is drawing up a list of worthy knights for your brother to consider, but until Jaime reappears < / p >
